discoveries.finding: New torch RMSnorm function changes results slightly and improves speed
discoveries.details: Available in PyTorch nightly, clearly faster without torch.compile, barely noticeable with compile

discoveries.finding: Kontext workflow useful for characters with different proportions
discoveries.details: Works well when reference character has different proportions than driving pose, like smaller characters

discoveries.finding: DWPose adds to noise before model pass in UniAnimate
discoveries.details: The pose information is injected into noise rather than replacing first frame

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate extends automatically with sliding window
discoveries.details: Uses 1 frame overlap, processes in chunks like Frames 0-77, then 76-153, then 152-229

discoveries.finding: Mask grow node updated to use GPU
discoveries.details: Previously slow CPU-based growing is now GPU accelerated

discoveries.finding: VitPose retargeting works better than DWPose for character scaling
discoveries.details: Good for height/body differences, though doesn't perfectly resize leg height proportions

discoveries.finding: Hand pose detection can be disabled for better results
discoveries.details: Set hand_stick_width to -1 to disable hand detection in VitPose

discoveries.finding: Using RGB input instead of pose for WanAnimate works well, especially for scenes with foreground elements causing pose jitter
discoveries.details: RGB loses likeness slightly more but handles problematic scenes better

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate as a model follows reference really well when mask and bg image are disconnected
discoveries.details: Pretty much 1-1 with reference, even picks up light watermarks. Adding bg and mask causes likeness to fall apart

discoveries.finding: Anisora V3.2 has new prompt structure with quality and motion scores
discoveries.details: aesthetic score: X.X. motion score: X.X. There is no text in the video.

discoveries.finding: 12 fps works better for consistency than 24 fps with WanAnimate
discoveries.details: 24 fps had awkward cuts and pose failures, 12 fps better consistency but worse image quality

discoveries.finding: Higher noise lightx2v model strength affects motion - lower strength = more motion, higher strength = less motion
discoveries.details: Changing strength of high noise lightx2v model changes motion in the picture

discoveries.finding: CFG=2 dramatically improves face similarity but can cause overfitting
discoveries.details: Face similarity improved dramatically but overall picture seems overfitted

discoveries.finding: VACE wrapper now works with differential diffusion using latent masks
discoveries.details: In wrapper adding latent mask enables differential diffusion, and native workflows can enable it with the node normally

discoveries.finding: Anisora v3.2 has distillation baked in
discoveries.details: 8 step inference works, can run with 3+4 steps at cfg 1 without distillation loras

discoveries.finding: HuMo can work as I2V model while retaining audio matching/lip syncing
discoveries.details: Modified model code to allow i2v latent input instead of overwriting with empty one, enables true I2V with audio conditioning

discoveries.finding: FP8 models load much faster in wrapper vs native
discoveries.details: FP8 model takes 1 second to load in wrapper while native takes 10 seconds

discoveries.finding: SageAttention negatively impacts HuMo audio tracking
discoveries.details: Visible degradation in lip sync quality when SageAttention is enabled

discoveries.finding: denoise_strength is roundabout way to set start_step with add_noise_to_samples=True
discoveries.details: Denoise 0.5 moves start_at_step and toggles add_noise_to_samples rather than acting like a mask

discoveries.finding: Lynx works with VACE
discoveries.details: Lynx lite version successfully works with VACE for face ID control

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate requires inverted canny
discoveries.details: Unlike regular canny edge detection, WanAnimate works better with inverted canny (white background with black edges)

discoveries.finding: AniSora 3.2 is distilled for cfg 1.0 and 8 steps
discoveries.details: AniSora 3.2 uses distillation technique, works at cfg 1.0 with 8 steps, sometimes better prompt adherence than cfg scheduling

discoveries.finding: Anisora high noise LoRA extraction works
discoveries.details: Successfully extracted high noise LoRA from AniSora 3.2, works as distillation LoRA

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 5B is 121 frames, not 81
discoveries.details: Wan 2.2 5B T2V model supports 121 frames for consistency, unlike other models capped at 81

discoveries.finding: Remap mask range helps background blending
discoveries.details: Adding remap mask range to mask improves blending into background but makes output look more like source

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate original code doesn't use CFG
discoveries.details: The original implementation doesn't use classifier-free guidance and uses hardcoded prompt '视频中的人在做动作'

discoveries.finding: Chinese vs English negative prompts have significant impact
discoveries.details: Chinese negative prompt tokenizes to 126 tokens vs English 99 tokens, and produces dramatically different results even when translated

discoveries.finding: Running text embed at fp32 increases prompt following
discoveries.details: Setting text embeddings to fp32 precision improves how well the model follows prompts

discoveries.finding: 720p resolution significantly improves HuMo quality
discoveries.details: HuMo performs noticeably better at 720p resolution as mentioned on project page

discoveries.finding: Pose detection and drawing separated in new preprocessor
discoveries.details: New node separates pose detection from drawing so you don't have to run detection again when adjusting drawing parameters

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate CFG setting in early access vs final code
discoveries.details: In early access code they had CFG functionality but it was never used. In final code it's used but CFG is set to 1.0, so it's effectively not used

discoveries.finding: Face input masking dependency
discoveries.details: If you don't use face input but use masking, you should input black images to the face input to avoid masking artifacts. The masking breaks if face embeds aren't applied at all

discoveries.finding: WanAnimate strength scaling effects
discoveries.details: At strength 2.0 on Wan 2.2 it's too much. Blocks 0-15 yield nice results but hair can be overexposed. WanAnimate is generally too strong and ruins prompt following and motion

discoveries.finding: Block selection flexibility for WanAnimate
discoveries.details: Can use partial blocks (0-5, 0-9, 0-15, 15-39, 10-39) with different strengths to control the effect and allow combination with other tools

discoveries.finding: Start percentage scheduling for character models
discoveries.details: Using start percentage 0.5 with WanAnimate allows better prompt following and motion while still getting likeness. Only needs a few steps to get likeness

discoveries.finding: IP adapter weakness in WanAnimate
discoveries.details: IP image input does something but is very weak. Setting IP to 0 gets all motion back, setting IP to 1 and ref to 0 loses likeness completely

discoveries.finding: KJ loader is faster than native model loading
discoveries.details: User complained about native model load speed being slow, found KJ loader significantly faster

discoveries.finding: HUMO + InfiniteTalk embed mixing improves results
discoveries.details: Mixing embeds from both models provides better acting from characters, better prompt adherence, and respects starting frame details more faithfully than either model alone

discoveries.finding: LightX2V with FastWan LoRA at 2 steps very fast
discoveries.details: LightX2V + FastWan at 2 steps executed in 31.49 seconds vs 70.63 seconds for LightX2V alone at 4 steps

discoveries.finding: Fun VACE 2.2 is better than VACE 2.1
discoveries.details: Better in every way from testing, even ignoring the extra High Noise part

discoveries.finding: High noise model has better prompt adherence than low noise model
discoveries.details: In prompt about blue rims of car, H model had blue rims but final output after L model was silver rim

discoveries.finding: HUMO stops talking when provided silence in audio
discoveries.details: Unlike the constant mouth movement issue, HUMO respects silent clips

discoveries.finding: Camera control prompting technique for I2V
discoveries.details: For pan right mention 'camera reveals something' or 'camera pans down revealing a white tiled floor' - works for controlling camera movement

discoveries.finding: Lynx makes WAN models run at 24fps instead of 16fps
discoveries.details: Users observed that using Lynx with WAN models changes the frame rate to 24fps, which was originally intended only for the lite version

discoveries.finding: LightX2V LoRAs affect motion characteristics
discoveries.details: Using LightX2V LoRAs on both models vs only on LOW model produces different motion effects

discoveries.finding: Lynx reference strength needs careful tuning
discoveries.details: At 0.6 strength works well, 1.0+ is too strong and creates 'face glued on video' effect, 1.5+ creates nightmare fuel

discoveries.finding: Different model combinations produce visual improvements
discoveries.details: Using 2.1 as high model + 2.2 low gives content of 2.1 with look of 2.2, acts like unofficial upgrade

discoveries.finding: OVI model shows better quality than base WAN 5B
discoveries.details: Some OVI generations are better than WAN 2.5 480p generations, with better sound/speech quality

discoveries.finding: Lynx works with I2V models but with different effects
discoveries.details: Lynx + I2V makes generation faster and changes timing, though unclear if doing much else

discoveries.finding: Kytra got native ComfyUI implementation working
discoveries.details: Implementation supports native comfy lora loading and everything native that can possibly be native without changing base ComfyUI

discoveries.finding: OVI video model is essentially 5B model with extra layers
discoveries.details: Works even without using the extra layers, shares cross attention when used with audio model

discoveries.finding: Audio model can potentially work alone
discoveries.details: Question remains whether audio model works independently from video model

discoveries.finding: Audio tensor is 1 dimensional with 157 length
discoveries.details: Default audio length for 31 latents (121 image frames)

discoveries.finding: OVI generates audio automatically
discoveries.details: Different usecase from Wan 2.2 Animate + Infinite Talk - OVI generates the audio too rather than lip-syncing

discoveries.finding: 5 seconds of audio encodes to 156 length
discoveries.details: When encoding exactly 5 seconds of audio, it results in length of 156

discoveries.finding: Audio addition makes motion more realistic
discoveries.details: Audio and video keep each other in check - can't have big sound without big action and vice versa

discoveries.finding: VAE memory issue is related to pytorch nightly version
discoveries.details: Current nightly causes VAE failures, downgrading to 2.8.0 stable fixes it

discoveries.finding: Specific torch versions work with Wan VAE
Ovi model works with French language
discoveries.details: Not perfect but generates French speech with some accuracy

discoveries.finding: SLG affects both video and audio
discoveries.details: Audio model is fully Wan model with 1 dimensional latent, both models run simultaneously and share cross attention

discoveries.finding: rCM lora shows better prompt following
discoveries.details: Bird lands on head or close to it 100% of seeds tested, better than base model

discoveries.finding: Context options work better when used only on first high noise steps
discoveries.details: Best results using context options for first two high noise steps, then one high noise step without context, and last 3 low noise steps without context

discoveries.finding: Clip embeds were never used in WanAnimate code causing huge difference in quality
discoveries.details: Minimal effect with distil loras but huge difference when running 20 steps cfg 1.0 like the original

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR works as fast upscaler
discoveries.details: One-step diffusion-based video super-resolution framework, reaches ~17 FPS at 768×1408 on single A100

discoveries.finding: EasyCache with OVI shows little difference from full 50 steps
discoveries.details: Pretty safe to use EasyCache for significant speed improvement

discoveries.finding: OVI is around 11B model size
discoveries.details: Smaller than people think, heaviness comes from original implementation and wrappers not using offloading

discoveries.finding: Strength setting added to combat oversharpening in FlashVSR
discoveries.details: Setting at 0.8 reduces oversharpening effects

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR can upscale from 1280x720 to 2560x1440
discoveries.details: Works well at this resolution range

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR uses tiny conditional decoder with LR frames as auxiliary inputs
discoveries.details: Leverages LR frames in addition to latents for HR reconstruction

discoveries.finding: Multi-step FlashVSR workflow using 2 samplers
discoveries.details: First sampler: 4 steps, seed 74, start_step 0, end_step 2, add_noise_to_samples true. Second sampler: 4 steps, seed 76, start_step 2, end_step 4, add_noise_to_samples false

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR can do pseudo image upscaling using repeated frames
discoveries.details: Video of 5 repeating images from 480x640 to 1536x2048

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR causes slight browning of colors
discoveries.details: Noticeable color shift during processing

discoveries.finding: torch.compile recompile limit causes OOM errors
discoveries.details: When hitting torch._dynamo config.recompile_limit (64), memory usage increases and can cause OOM. Increasing cache size limit can help temporarily

discoveries.finding: Faster cancellation commit causes more OOM issues
discoveries.details: The faster cancellation feature (commit 3374e900d0f310100ebe54944175a36f287110cb) multiplies recompile count and causes allocation errors faster, even without pressing cancel button

discoveries.finding: LightX2V now has native ComfyUI fp8 models
discoveries.details: New fp8 models available that don't require LoRA, including wan2.2_i2v_A14b_high_noise_scaled_fp8_e4m3_lightx2v_4step_comfyui.safetensors

discoveries.finding: Torch 2.9 resolves compile issues
discoveries.details: Upgrading to torch 2.9.0+cu130 with updated triton and sageattention fixes previous torch compile problems

discoveries.finding: SageAttention torch.compile compatibility added
discoveries.details: New sageattn mode allows torch.compile to work with latest SageAttention version, primarily reduces peak VRAM usage by about 1GB (15.749GB -> 14.667GB max allocated)

discoveries.finding: Force parameter static shapes toggle can resolve cl.exe compilation errors
discoveries.details: Setting 'Force_parameter_static_shape' to false temporarily resolved cl.exe/algorithm header compilation errors, even when set back to true afterwards

discoveries.finding: SageAttention 2.2 performance improvement
discoveries.details: Upgraded from months-old workflow to latest SageAttention turned 255 second generation into 191 second generation

discoveries.finding: Dynamic parameter in torch compile causes cl.exe errors on Windows
discoveries.details: Setting Dynamic to true triggers cl.exe lookup and algorithm header file errors. Setting to false resolves the issue.

discoveries.finding: MoCha model uses double compute by concatenating original frames along temporal dimension
discoveries.details: Memory use similar to 161 frames when generating 81 frames, making it much more resource intensive than standard models

discoveries.finding: Safetensors uses memory mapping by default
discoveries.details: Weights are loaded only when actually used, not instantly loaded to memory when loading state dict

discoveries.finding: Reference latents can be used with I2V for multiple context windows
discoveries.details: Context window node was updated to take latents, allowing you to provide starting frames for each context window using VAE to convert series of images into latents

discoveries.finding: Empty positive prompts work better for character consistency
discoveries.details: Leaving positive prompt completely empty improves character likeness, especially for non-human characters. Only exception is cats where adding 'cat' in positive helps

discoveries.finding: Background removal improves character likeness
discoveries.details: Using RemBG to remove background and replace with white background, then disabling mask input and background input while disabling relight lora significantly improves character consistency

discoveries.finding: LCM scheduler reduces burn with distill LoRAs
discoveries.details: When using more steps with distill LoRAs, LCM scheduler prevents overcooked/burned images compared to dpm++_sde

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.1 and 2.2 low noise LoRAs work with WAN Animate
discoveries.details: Confirmed that LoRAs designed for Wan 2.1 or 2.2 low noise models can be used with Animate workflow

discoveries.finding: Detail enhancer LoRAs add character detail to video
discoveries.details: Using detail enhancer LoRAs can improve character details in video output

discoveries.finding: Exact same likeness achieved with tiger reference
discoveries.details: Tiger in generated video matches exactly the reference image

discoveries.finding: Some fp32 layers improve fp8_scaled performance
discoveries.details: Running some layers in fp32 seems to make fp8_scaled work better

discoveries.finding: SVI LoRA has some effect with VACE but limited
discoveries.details: SVI LoRA works with VACE for better consistency but still loops without control past 201 frames, not as effective as with I2V

discoveries.finding: Light VAE can be used to speed up VAE processing
discoveries.details: Light VAE is faster on high resolution and more frames, especially helpful for low VRAM setups like 2060. Works with wrapper but not native ComfyUI yet. Quality loss but speed gain is significant.

discoveries.finding: New ComfyUI pinned memory flag speeds up offloading
discoveries.details: --fast pinned_memory flag speeds up weight offloading, fixes long durations with 'Using accelerate to load and assign model weights to device' messages

discoveries.finding: Wrapper decode node can decode latents from native workflows
discoveries.details: Can use wrapper decode node to decode latents from native workflows, enables mixing between implementations

discoveries.finding: New RAM pressure cache system implemented in ComfyUI
discoveries.details: Cache sensitive to RAM pressure that evicts RAM-expensive nodes when headroom drops below threshold. Measures models and tensors directly for RAM usage with OOM scoring.

discoveries.finding: VACE strength can be set per step in wrapper
discoveries.details: In wrapper you can set vace strength per step - control, ref, and original frame strength. For 2.2 high: ref strength at 1, depth at 0.3, pose at 0.4

discoveries.finding: Empty frame value should be applied (e.g. black if 0 instead of always 0.5 grey) for better control
discoveries.details: The empty_frame_value parameter wasn't being applied correctly and was defaulting to 0.5 grey instead of proper values like black (0)

discoveries.finding: Modified control images can slowly bring in raw video for VACE motion pickup
discoveries.details: By modifying control images to gradually incorporate raw video content, VACE can pick up motion patterns more effectively

discoveries.finding: High and low models have 2x different generation times
discoveries.details: For WAN I2V specifically, high noise model consistently takes 2x longer than low noise model (e.g. 30 sec vs 15 sec per iteration)

discoveries.finding: GGUF models show opposite performance pattern
discoveries.details: With GGUF versions, the performance ratio is reversed compared to regular models

discoveries.finding: E5M2 models have slow transformer loading issues
discoveries.details: E5M2 format takes significantly longer to load transformer compared to E4M3FN and GGUF versions, despite using torch.compile

discoveries.finding: Character LoRAs make T2V look significantly better
discoveries.details: Using character-specific LoRAs improves T2V generation quality noticeably

discoveries.finding: SVI-shot instead of SVI-film reduces degradation
discoveries.details: Change LoRA to svi-shot (kj rank128 version) and set overlap frames to 1

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 can generate high quality still images
discoveries.details: Set frame number to 1, increase output size, and lower shift to 2 or 3

discoveries.finding: HuMo works with image to video conditioning
discoveries.details: Model is capable of I2V but implementations don't pass image conditioning. Modification is simple but required

discoveries.finding: Wan models produce 4*n+1 frames in latent space
discoveries.details: Each latent frame encodes 4 real frames plus 1 extra. Frame counts should be 49, 53, etc.

discoveries.finding: I2V conditioning uses specific latent channels
discoveries.details: Channels 1-16 are standard noisy latents, 17-20 are I2V mask, 21-36 are I2V conditioning inputs

discoveries.finding: Gray values should be used for overlapping I2V conditioning latents
discoveries.details: All latents that overlap with noise latents should be gray values, not zeros. Only unused bindweave references should be zeros

discoveries.finding: I2V channel color values significantly affect generation
discoveries.details: White seems to increase prompt adherence, different grayscale values change video output completely on same seed

discoveries.finding: HuMo works well at 81 frames for preventing lip sync issues, but can work up to 97 frames consistently
discoveries.details: 81 frames is more reliable for preventing slow motion or lip sync issues, though 97 frames still works

discoveries.finding: Flash issues in HuMo may be related to using wrong frame counts
discoveries.details: Using 89 frames instead of 81 might cause flash artifacts

discoveries.finding: Using fp16 models fixes HuMo flash issues
discoveries.details: Using Humo fp16 with fp16 VAE fixes flash artifacts vs using scaled fp8 models

discoveries.finding: HuMo works much better with gray frames vs not provided frames or first frame copy frames
discoveries.details: Gray frames as intermediate frames produce better results with fewer steps (5 vs 12)

discoveries.finding: Video to video lip sync with HuMo is possible
discoveries.details: Can add lip sync to existing videos, also enables face swap with lip sync functionality

discoveries.finding: Combining Wan 2.2 High Noise with HuMo as second pass creates good results
discoveries.details: Using Wan 2.2 for first pass and HuMo for lip sync injection works well

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.1 FLF model can work as high pass for first-last frame generation
discoveries.details: Using FLF model designed for first-last frame instead of normal i2v method can give better results

discoveries.finding: MagRef works well as High Noise model in multi-pass workflows
discoveries.details: Can use MagRef model for first pass in combination workflows

discoveries.finding: wan2.2_i2v_A14b_low_noise_lora_rank64_lightx2v_4step_1022 as distill model has main impact on reducing HuMo flash issue
discoveries.details: Using this specific distill model, combined with mid gray frames after first frame, shift decreased to 4, steps increased to 6, and strong sampler/scheduler (dpmpp_sde_2s/beta57) helps fix flashing

discoveries.finding: HuMo can be used as a second pass with any first pass model
discoveries.details: Can use T2V with VACE as first pass and HuMo as second pass, or use WanAnimate, Magref, or Wan2.1FLF as first pass

discoveries.finding: HuMo flash issue wasn't caused by HuMo itself but by the sampler
discoveries.details: Sampler was duplicating first latent frame and padding at front when frame counts didn't match, pushing real frames forward. Fixed by changing sampler to only pad/trim at end

discoveries.finding: VAE produces grid noise when sampling results in blurry latent data
discoveries.details: VAE is trained on normal non-blurry videos, so blurry frames are 'out of domain' and produce horrible results

discoveries.finding: VitPose can extract human joints from sketches unlike DWPose
discoveries.details: Allows WanAnimate to work with hand-drawn sketches and stick figures as driving source

discoveries.finding: Wan latent space is compressed by factor of 8 spatially, 4 temporally
discoveries.details: Error 'Expected size 128 but got size 80' means 80*8=640 vs 128*8=1024 resolution mismatch

discoveries.finding: FlashVSR Triton PTX error on Blackwell GPUs can be fixed with environment variables
discoveries.details: Setting TORCH_COMPILE_BACKEND=eager and TRITON_PTXAS_PATH environment variables in ComfyUI startup fixes 'Value sm_121a is not defined for option gpu-name' error

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 I2V can do upscaling/refinement without VACE
discoveries.details: Using reference image with rough animation (cut-outs of character moving) can generate new video keeping likeness without needing VACE

discoveries.finding: VACE inpainting requires baking mask into original video as grey areas
discoveries.details: The control video for VACE can't just be the mask - you need to bake the mask into the original video so masked areas appear as grey, then VACE samples those areas

discoveries.finding: WanVideo mask previews show different frame counts for different embed types
discoveries.details: Bindweave embeds show 21 frame latents (17 frames + 4 references), vanilla I2V shows 17 frames matching video length. Masks show 9 frames for Bindweave, 5 for vanilla I2V

discoveries.finding: Wan models can do inpainting using latent noise mask without control inputs
discoveries.details: Any Wan model supports inpainting with latent noise masks, though it has higher chance of getting weird and works best with fractional denoising

discoveries.finding: Wan video masks in latent space get reshaped to match latent video dimensions
discoveries.details: 17 frame video becomes 5 frames in latent space. Masks tensor [17,480,480] becomes [1,4,5,60,60] where 4 channels store masks for each frame

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 I2V models don't have img_emb layers
discoveries.details: Unlike Wan 2.1 I2V which has img_emb layers, Wan 2.2 I2V models lack these layers so clip vision inputs get ignored

discoveries.finding: HuMo flash issue can be mitigated by separating conditioning
discoveries.details: Providing only FF2LF embeds to HN and only HuMo embeds to LN reduces flash, avoiding combined conditioning

discoveries.finding: Context windows work with native Wan implementation
discoveries.details: Non-Wan context windows node with dim==2 works for longer generations, but combining with HuMo conditioning still causes issues at higher frame counts

discoveries.finding: HuMo native ComfyUI implementation only uses one reference image
discoveries.details: The native code truncates reference images to just use the last one in the list, throwing away the rest. Wrapper implementation correctly supports multiple reference images (up to 4 like Phantom)

discoveries.finding: Context windows work in latent space for Wan
discoveries.details: 16 length context window = 16 latents, not 16 frames. 81 context is actually 81 * 4 frames. Context windows get disabled if above frame count

discoveries.finding: HuMo supports multiple reference images in wrapper
discoveries.details: Can use up to 4 reference images with batch loading. Native implementation was incorrectly coded to only use one

discoveries.finding: Audio embeds can work with context windows for HuMo
discoveries.details: Required modifying context windows to properly handle HuMo audio embedding slicing

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.1 VACE module performs better than Fun VACE 2.2 Low-Noise Module for low-noise sampling
discoveries.details: Testing shows 2.1 VACE gives more natural and integrated results on low-noise side

discoveries.finding: 2.1 T2V model with extracted A14B LN lora performs even better for low-noise sampling
discoveries.details: Combining 2.1 T2V + A14B LN Lora on low-noise side produces superior results

discoveries.finding: Multiple input images work with Wan 2.2 i2v models for overlap
discoveries.details: Can feed 5 images in batch to wanimagetovideo node for smooth continuations, use frame counts matching latent requirements (1, 5, 9 frames)

discoveries.finding: Conditioning lines carry all references and embeddings
discoveries.details: Don't need Humo latent output, conditioning lines handle references

discoveries.finding: Context windows only apply character references to first window
discoveries.details: Character drift occurs because subsequent windows ignore references, needs custom code to align

discoveries.finding: Kijai added PainterI2V motion amplification to WanVideoWrapper
discoveries.details: New experimental feature: augment_empty_frames parameter (0.0-10.0) to force more motion by augmenting empty frames with difference to start image

discoveries.finding: Wan 2.2 High with HuMo Low combination provides better prompt adherence and motion
discoveries.details: T2V with Wan 2.2 as High noise and HuMo as Low noise gives better motion and prompt adherence compared to just HuMo alone

discoveries.finding: Initial step without LightX LoRA improves motion and character consistency
discoveries.details: Using 1-3 steps without speed LoRA at the beginning of sampling helps lock in better motion and character consistency

discoveries.finding: Audio-reactive WanMove with pose detection works well
discoveries.details: Generated sound modulated tracks with pose detection can create dynamic motion effects that sync with audio

discoveries.finding: Humo works well for maintaining character consistency across different perspectives
discoveries.details: HuMo effectively frames the subject in the same scene but from different perspectives

discoveries.finding: Torch 2.9 breaks AudioEncoderEncode node
discoveries.details: AudioEncoderEncode fails with NotImplementedError on torch 2.9 due to flash attention compatibility issues with RTX 5090, works with torch 2.8

discoveries.finding: Context windowing works well with specific model types
discoveries.details: Models where I2V and T2V are the same model just tuned differently (like Kandinsky, HunyuanVideo1.5) work better with context windowing

discoveries.finding: SCAIL can be used with dance moves from AIST dataset
discoveries.details: Dataset converted from pkl to npy format and hosted on Huggingface, autodownloads when library is called in nodes

discoveries.finding: Qwen edit multiple angles lora works well for rotation consistency
discoveries.details: Works amazingly for handling subjects that rotate and show different angles in video

discoveries.finding: Custom slicing of context windows is now merged into ComfyUI
discoveries.details: Allows using context windows with Vace and Phantom inputs, enables custom conditioning input slicing

discoveries.finding: Multiple character support added to SCAIL audio nodes
discoveries.details: Updated dance library with multiple character support in the repo

discoveries.finding: FBX animations can be converted to openpose
discoveries.details: New custom node uses Blender in background to obtain JSON info from FBX files

discoveries.finding: Phantom is best for handling subject rotation
discoveries.details: Most effective for cases where subjects rotate extensively showing front and back

discoveries.finding: ONNX model files have 4GB limit requiring separate .onnx and .bin files
discoveries.details: Both files must be in same folder and you load the onnx file

discoveries.finding: SCAIL requires matching starting pose between reference image and animation
discoveries.details: Gorilla starting in standing pose doesn't work well with crouching woman reference video

discoveries.finding: SCAIL animates your image so starting composition matters
discoveries.details: For shots where person runs away, start from full body shot that moves to camera then runs away to have all ref content from first frame

discoveries.finding: Native nodes more RAM hungry than wrapper nodes
discoveries.details: BF16 Wan 2.2 high/low + Humo workflow using 96% of 128GB RAM and 78% of 96GB VRAM

discoveries.finding: Block 0 causes unwanted behavior in WanMove LoRA
discoveries.details: Setting block 0 to 0.0 makes output much better and more coherent

discoveries.finding: WanMove LoRA works naturally on Wan 2.2 without block modifications
discoveries.details: 2.2 just naturally understood the conditioning, but failed on 2.1 models

discoveries.finding: SVI Pro is a recent totally new trained version of SVI that needs totally different input types
discoveries.details: It's for Wan2.2 HN/LN workflow and does frame anchoring of SVI-shot with smooth continuations of SVI-film, fully compatible with Wan2.2 and LightX2V

discoveries.finding: WanMove can be extracted as a LoRA
discoveries.details: Testing showed you can extract WanMove as a lora by testing it with Wan2.2

discoveries.finding: Frames in console log are in latent space
discoveries.details: The calculation is (41 - 1) / 4 + 1 = 11

discoveries.finding: Motion latent count logic
discoveries.details: 1 latent = 4 frames +1, so if you set motion latent count to 2, you need overlap to 9

discoveries.finding: SVI 2.0 Pro was trained with 1 motion latent (4 frames)
discoveries.details: Setting to anything else would be wrong

discoveries.finding: SCAIL vs LTX 2 trade-offs
discoveries.details: SCAIL is better at movements and copying poses from video but worse at facial consistency. LTX 2 is better at face/skin quality and consistent facial expressions but worse at pose copying.

discoveries.finding: Skyreels V3 includes InfiniteTalk
discoveries.details: When using Skyreels V3 as base model, you don't need to connect the InfiniteTalk model separately as it's already included

discoveries.finding: Skyreels works without ref video
discoveries.details: Skyreels can function without reference video, though it becomes similar to multitalk without it

discoveries.finding: Reference video helps longer generations
discoveries.details: Reference video in Skyreels is more meant to help with longer video generations

troubleshooting.problem: 36 channel error in WanAnimate workflow
troubleshooting.solution: Update nodes to main branch and check for conflicting installations with same class names

troubleshooting.problem: Set node stuck in STRING mode after update
troubleshooting.solution: Delete old set node and create new one with same name 'pose_images'

troubleshooting.problem: Memory errors with high frame count videos
troubleshooting.solution: VHS and ComfyUI struggle with high frame counts, reduce frame count or use Load Video from Path node

troubleshooting.problem: Minutes-long generation times
troubleshooting.solution: Usually indicates running out of VRAM, monitor with GPUz and restart ComfyUI when VRAM hits 6000MB

troubleshooting.problem: Black rectangle artifacts from mask
troubleshooting.solution: Update to latest commit, ensure mask block size isn't too small, keep face strength at 1.0

troubleshooting.problem: Dependency conflicts causing channel errors
troubleshooting.solution: Use virtual environments, check for conflicting pydantic and numpy versions

troubleshooting.problem: FP8 e4m3fn compatibility with RTX 3000/AMD
troubleshooting.solution: Use fp8_e5m2 quantization instead when using torch.compile

troubleshooting.problem: Can't use built-in looping of WanAnimate with multiple samplers
troubleshooting.solution: Deactivate built-in looping by having frame_window_size and num_frames equal, use shorter clips or context windows instead

troubleshooting.problem: Error when passing WanAnimate embeds to sampler without WanAnimate model
troubleshooting.solution: Use normal I2V node on the other sampler instead

troubleshooting.problem: Can't set use_non_blocking to true, always hits OOM
troubleshooting.solution: It's about RAM - bigger vitpose model might push to RAM limit

troubleshooting.problem: Denoise strength set to zero still applies denoising
troubleshooting.solution: Denoise just adjusts start step - use start_step parameter instead for Wan 2.2

troubleshooting.problem: WanAnimatePreprocess nodes not loading despite no errors
troubleshooting.solution: Browser cache issue - restart browser or clear cache

troubleshooting.problem: utf-8 codec error with .onnx files
troubleshooting.solution: Compute SHA256 checksum on .onnx files and compare against huggingface - likely broken file

troubleshooting.problem: start_step must be 0 when denoise_strength is used error
troubleshooting.solution: Set denoise to 1 and increase start_step instead. For 4 total steps, use start step of 2

troubleshooting.problem: Missing detection folder for preprocessor nodes
troubleshooting.solution: Create detection folder inside models/ directory: mkdir -p /workspace/ComfyUI/models/detection

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI shows 0 in sampler but field is actually empty
troubleshooting.solution: Click on the field and manually fill in 0 again

troubleshooting.problem: WanAnimate native workflow shows black image while wrapper works
troubleshooting.solution: All conditions need to be the same, check model loading and settings

troubleshooting.problem: GPU disabling and computer freezing with Wan Animate on RTX 5090
troubleshooting.solution: Likely power supply issue - Wan Animate has larger blocks so heavier compute load

troubleshooting.problem: SAM2Segmentation bbox error
troubleshooting.solution: Use points instead of box input, or rebuild the node if conflicts with other custom nodes

troubleshooting.problem: Wrapper not loading in latest ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Remove xformers from lib folder - it's outdated and causes conflicts

troubleshooting.problem: UnicodeDecodeError on WanVideoWrapper startup
troubleshooting.solution: Update the wrapper to latest version to resolve UTF-8 encoding issue

troubleshooting.problem: UTF-8 error persists after update
troubleshooting.solution: Issue acknowledged, user will find own solution

troubleshooting.problem: Weird long hangs after recent update
troubleshooting.solution: Update everything again and remove unused custom nodes

troubleshooting.problem: OOM on 5090 with multiGPU nodes
troubleshooting.solution: No solution provided, VAE and text encoders successfully offloaded to 3090

troubleshooting.problem: Background completely static in WanAnimate
troubleshooting.solution: Use inverted canny instead of regular canny, prompt for motion like 'driving a car'

troubleshooting.problem: Infinitetalk doesn't work with 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: Connect multitalk only to high model sampler, use normal image embeds for low model, don't connect multitalk model to low sampler

troubleshooting.problem: Missing mask frames causes reference image mismatch
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure mask has no gaps across all frames, create continuous mask in After Effects

troubleshooting.problem: VAE decode times varying dramatically (10s vs 3 minutes)
troubleshooting.solution: Check if tiling is activating automatically - terminal might show 'cant decode, using vae tiling'

troubleshooting.problem: onnxruntime module not found error
troubleshooting.solution: Need to pip install onnxruntime-gpu in ComfyUI virtual environment, some systems may need specific version like 1.18 for AMD

troubleshooting.problem: Pose detection running on CPU instead of GPU
troubleshooting.solution: Install onnxruntime-gpu instead of onnxruntime - installing regular onnxruntime can force CPU usage

troubleshooting.problem: Blocks visible in WanAnimate subject replacement
troubleshooting.solution: Native implementation doesn't send empty pixels when face isn't used - need to ensure face adapter executes or use wrapper implementation

troubleshooting.problem: CFG generations looking worse than distill versions
troubleshooting.solution: CFG > 1 often produces worse results than distill LoRAs - try simpler prompts or stick with distill approach

troubleshooting.problem: Grid noise pattern in WanAnimate results
troubleshooting.solution: Fixed by using the new v2 fp8 scaled model which works properly in native ComfyUI

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention auto mode doesn't work with WanAnimate on 4090
troubleshooting.solution: Issue occurs when using clip vision in native. ComfyUI has a workaround that can be activated with command line arg

troubleshooting.problem: Black result when torch compiling WanAnimate
troubleshooting.solution: Related to SageAttention auto mode issue with clip vision

troubleshooting.problem: Masking artifacts when not using face input
troubleshooting.solution: Input black pixels/frames to face input instead of leaving disconnected. In wrapper this is handled automatically, but in native you need to do it manually

troubleshooting.problem: Custom sigmas producing black/broken images
troubleshooting.solution: Never have two sigma values that are the same in the list

troubleshooting.problem: HUMO unwanted mouth movement when no audio
troubleshooting.solution: Delete line in prompt guider that was part of 'do not quote lyrics line' - this stopped unwanted mouth movements

troubleshooting.problem: Wrapper fp8_scaled_fast error with empty LoRA
troubleshooting.solution: Bug occurs when empty LoRA list is passed, fixed by Kijai checking for empty list vs None

troubleshooting.problem: OOM on 4090 with 125 frames
troubleshooting.solution: Drop frame window size from 81 to 41, or use batching approach with last frame carryover

troubleshooting.problem: Color shift/washout in I2V chain extensions
troubleshooting.solution: Use VACE with last few frames instead of single frame, crossfade between videos to hide color shifting gradually

troubleshooting.problem: WanAnimate face shaking with movement in new workflow
troubleshooting.solution: Issue identified with new Kijai workflow with preprocessor, didn't happen in old workflow

troubleshooting.problem: Wan 2.2 I2V last 10 frames degradation
troubleshooting.solution: Consistently happening issue visible from high noise model generation, changing samplers/shift didn't work

troubleshooting.problem: sageattn_varlen doesn't work on AMD
troubleshooting.solution: Use sdpa with masking (though slow) or flash_attn_varlen alternatives

troubleshooting.problem: Lynx shows 'no lynx reference adapter layers found' error
troubleshooting.solution: Need to use correct base model that includes lynx layers, check example workflow notes

troubleshooting.problem: ONNX CUDA error with insightface dependency
troubleshooting.solution: Missing insightface dependency compilation, needs proper installation

troubleshooting.problem: WAN 2.2 5B VAE suddenly using much more VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Issue appeared after updates, may need tiled decode which takes longer

troubleshooting.problem: Video previews not working after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Switch from h265 to h264 codec

troubleshooting.problem: Lynx causing instant OOM with previously working settings
troubleshooting.solution: Use full block swap and reduce resolution (e.g., 320x240 for 121 frames)

troubleshooting.problem: Video output issues fixed with latent scaling
troubleshooting.solution: Use latent scaling suggestion

troubleshooting.problem: GGUF quantization changing audio tensor shape
troubleshooting.solution: Added ModelWanAudio class in convert.py with correct keys_detect and keys_hiprec

troubleshooting.problem: Getting Nans and corrupted results
troubleshooting.solution: Use bf16 instead of fp16 for base precision - fp16 causes issues with this model

troubleshooting.problem: Video going black on last step with fp16_fast
troubleshooting.solution: Use bf16 base precision - fp16 has issues with this model

troubleshooting.problem: Audio sounding like gibberish or thug-like
troubleshooting.solution: Use SLG (set to 11) and proper CFG values - CFG and SLG matter a lot for audio

troubleshooting.problem: Missing OVI nodes in ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Switch to OVI branch: git fetch --all, git switch ovi, and install missing dependencies

troubleshooting.problem: Rendering freezing at final stage
troubleshooting.solution: Add block swap node for VRAM issues, or try turning OVI CFG up to 5

troubleshooting.problem: fp16 precision causes black output
troubleshooting.solution: Video looks fine until last step then gets NaNs and goes black

troubleshooting.problem: Video stops abruptly while audio continues
troubleshooting.solution: Caused by webm encoding issues, switch to mp4 format

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI crashes when loading Wan node on ovi branch
troubleshooting.solution: Install librosa and omegaconf dependencies manually

troubleshooting.problem: VACE workflow error 'too many values to unpack'
troubleshooting.solution: Switch back to main branch or use updated VACE fix

troubleshooting.problem: OOM on 4090 with OVI
troubleshooting.solution: Use fp8 models and full block swap (30 blocks), disable torch compile and easycache

troubleshooting.problem: Lynx error with wrong resampler
troubleshooting.solution: Use LITE resampler with LITE ip model, not FULL resampler

troubleshooting.problem: Error 'blocks.0.audio_block.modulation' KeyError
troubleshooting.solution: Update the wrapper to fix the issue

troubleshooting.problem: Can't pass CFG list to WanVideo OVI CFG
troubleshooting.solution: TypeError occurs with audio_cfg_scale calculations, known issue

troubleshooting.problem: Getting black output with darker scenes in OVI
troubleshooting.solution: Try more steps, change prompts, adjust lighting in prompt

troubleshooting.problem: Image degradation with InfiniteTalk audio_scale above 1.0
troubleshooting.solution: No clear solution found, artifacts and saturation increase with higher audio_scale

troubleshooting.problem: Colors drifting in WanAnimate
troubleshooting.solution: Use context options vs original - context minimizes color drift but causes background morphing

troubleshooting.problem: UnboundLocalError with LQ_images in FlashVSR
troubleshooting.solution: Update the wrapper to latest version

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR doesn't process all frames
troubleshooting.solution: 161 frames input resulted in 157 frames output - known issue

troubleshooting.problem: Strength setting turns to NaN when opening new workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Have to manually set it to 0 again each time

troubleshooting.problem: Getting 'got multiple values for keyword argument is_uncond' error
troubleshooting.solution: Right click sampler and pick 'Fix Node (recreate)' to fix after sampler modifications

troubleshooting.problem: TinyVAE (taew2_1) stopped working after update
troubleshooting.solution: Fixed by Kijai in latest update

troubleshooting.problem: Mono audio causing 'too many values to unpack' error
troubleshooting.solution: Fixed unsqueeze issue - audio was being reshaped to 1,1,1,length instead of B,C,L

troubleshooting.problem: RAM stays high after generations and doesn't clear
troubleshooting.solution: Remove upscale model node if present as it doubles image size and creates copies

troubleshooting.problem: torch._dynamo hit config.recompile_limit (64) error
troubleshooting.solution: Increase cache size limit to 128 or higher, clear triton caches, use --reserve-vram 2 flag

troubleshooting.problem: Triton cache causing compilation errors
troubleshooting.solution: Delete triton caches at C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Temp\torchinductor_<username>\triton and C:\Users\<username>\.triton

troubleshooting.problem: Black output with new I2V Wan2.2 models
troubleshooting.solution: Use the ComfyUI-specific version of the model, original version has incorrect format

troubleshooting.problem: OOM errors after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Update WanVideoWrapper node with git pull, disable torch compile nodes if needed

troubleshooting.problem: Triton compilation errors on Windows
troubleshooting.solution: Clear triton cache, check antivirus exceptions, may need to reinstall triton or use different version

troubleshooting.problem: First run with torch compile uses more VRAM
troubleshooting.solution: Torch 2.8.0 has this issue, workaround is to run another workflow first or upgrade to 2.9

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR resize node 'per_batch' input error
troubleshooting.solution: Right click the node and click 'Fix node (recreate)', then re-enter the values. The per_batch input was experimental and later reverted

troubleshooting.problem: Video dimensions mismatch in VSR sampler
troubleshooting.solution: Use a node to check what the Load Video node actually loaded and make sure dimensions and number of frames match what the sampler expects

troubleshooting.problem: 27GB LoRA causing OOMs
troubleshooting.solution: That's actually a full fp16 model categorized as LoRA, should be called a checkpoint instead

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention DLL load failed error
troubleshooting.solution: Delete 'flow match' folder inside custom_nodes, restart ComfyUI. Issue related to incorrect SageAttention and Triton installation

troubleshooting.problem: Workflow errors mentioning ovi and lynx when using Wan
troubleshooting.solution: Update the wrapper and kjnodes to fix compatibility issues

troubleshooting.problem: cl.exe algorithm header compilation errors
troubleshooting.solution: Toggle 'Force_parameter_static_shape' to false, which can reset the compilation system. May also need proper Visual Studio C++ paths set

troubleshooting.problem: SageAttention compile producing noisy output
troubleshooting.solution: Use regular sage mode instead of sage_compile if getting noisy results

troubleshooting.problem: Cannot open include file: 'algorithm' error on Windows
troubleshooting.solution: Add INCLUDE system environment variable with path to MSVC include directory or set Dynamic to false in torch compile

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile dynamic mode fails on Windows
troubleshooting.solution: Set dynamic parameter to false - Windows triton isn't full triton

troubleshooting.problem: Memory leak in loops with custom nodes
troubleshooting.solution: JoyCaption node doesn't unload models properly - check custom nodes for proper memory management

troubleshooting.problem: VAE torch compile causes rainbow flickering after first run
troubleshooting.solution: Issue occurs when dragging compile option to VAE, works first time but corrupts subsequent outputs

troubleshooting.problem: SDPA with torch compile causes crashes
troubleshooting.solution: Make sure attention is set to sage instead of sdpa when using torch compile

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoEncode error 'local variable out referenced before assignment'
troubleshooting.solution: Issue appears to be related to VAE loading in the loop. Try updating ComfyUI Essential nodes or modifying VAE loader within the loop

troubleshooting.problem: Mocha error 'view_as_complex only supported for half, float and double tensors, but got BFloat16'
troubleshooting.solution: Update the wrapper and clear triton cache. Delete C:\Users\<username>\.triton folder

troubleshooting.problem: Portrait resolutions failing with OVI
troubleshooting.solution: Set divisible by to 32 instead of 16. Issue is latent space requirements - something divisible by 2 isn't necessarily divisible by 16

troubleshooting.problem: Mocha generating max 5 seconds
troubleshooting.solution: If using context options, set context frame count to same as frame window count

troubleshooting.problem: Face appearing despite face_strength set to 0
troubleshooting.solution: Disable the LoRA entirely and run at 20 steps for correct results without face generation

troubleshooting.problem: Context window transition artifacts in WAN Animation
troubleshooting.solution: Try different High and Low noise settings in Wan 2.2, or use Magref model for Wan 2.1 workflows as it handles transitions better

troubleshooting.problem: Face likeness degradation with CFG 3 on low noise
troubleshooting.solution: Use higher CFG on high noise (3.5-4) and lower on low noise (2.5) to prevent face degradation

troubleshooting.problem: LongCat changes broke other models with head_norm error
troubleshooting.solution: Kijai pushed a fix for the WanI2VCrossAttention.__init__() unexpected keyword argument 'head_norm' error

troubleshooting.problem: Fun InP doesn't support control images
troubleshooting.solution: Use Fun Control model for control images - Fun InP is only for in-between frames

troubleshooting.problem: Hair doesn't fit within driving video mask
troubleshooting.solution: Expand the mask around head area to accommodate voluminous hair that extends beyond the tight bbox

troubleshooting.problem: CUDA OOM errors with latest ComfyUI nightly
troubleshooting.solution: Turn off non-blocking in block swap node or roll back ComfyUI version. New RAM management changes causing issues.

troubleshooting.problem: RAM usage peaks much higher and inconsistent
troubleshooting.solution: Disable non-blocking on block swap node. May need to increase block swap count due to LoRA weights now attached to blocks.

troubleshooting.problem: Can't install LightVAE
troubleshooting.solution: Use with wrapper instead of native ComfyUI - native support coming later

troubleshooting.problem: Lightning4step LoRA makes everything super bright with fake details
troubleshooting.solution: Switch to lightx2v LoRA which is more realistic but may need contrast adjustments. Can try mixing both LoRAs or use at 0.25 strength.

troubleshooting.problem: LightX2V LoRA causes washed out colors and detail loss
troubleshooting.solution: Use at 0.25 strength to maintain speed without losing quality on low noise. Consider using t2v detailers with very low denoise for retouching.

troubleshooting.problem: Second sampler taking 12-15GB more RAM and failing
troubleshooting.solution: Try using LoRA merging option instead of applying on the fly

troubleshooting.problem: GGUF models not being found in checkpoint folder
troubleshooting.solution: Models need to be moved to diffusion folder instead of checkpoint folder

troubleshooting.problem: CUDA OOM issues with recent ComfyUI updates
troubleshooting.solution: Add --disable-pinned-memory to launch script

troubleshooting.problem: Neck and shoulders not showing up in first frames during pose retargeting
troubleshooting.solution: This is normal behavior from pose estimation, not a bug

troubleshooting.problem: WAN 2.2 Animate forcing 5-second output when input is shorter
troubleshooting.solution: The number of frames generated is set by the embed creation node, not input length - it fills missing frames with blanks

troubleshooting.problem: Issues with WAN and GGUF models
troubleshooting.solution: Try --disable-pinned-memory argument

troubleshooting.problem: fp8 dtype causing 'mul_cuda' not implemented error
troubleshooting.solution: Don't use fp8 for text projection input, cast to fp32 or use base torch ops

troubleshooting.problem: Tiled VAE extremely slow with wrapper nodes
troubleshooting.solution: Update to latest wrapper version and clear Triton caches, or use native VAE with WanVideoToVAELatents node

troubleshooting.problem: Tiled VAE temporal blending at frame 45
troubleshooting.solution: Increase temporal_size setting to match or exceed total frames (e.g., 84 for 81 frames)

troubleshooting.problem: Wan Animate cutting frames
troubleshooting.solution: Use frame counts that follow 4*n+1 pattern (49, 53, etc.) as model works with these in latent space

troubleshooting.problem: VAE 2x upscaler size mismatch with Wan 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: Use VAE utils node by spacepxl for loading VAE and VAE decode

troubleshooting.problem: SVI continuation color shift and contrast degradation
troubleshooting.solution: Use svi-shot instead of svi-film, try more overlap frames (9 or 13), use weight scaling

troubleshooting.problem: Getting '36 channels vs 32 channels' error
troubleshooting.solution: Check for model mismatch, particularly VAE file as first step

troubleshooting.problem: Bindweave workflow error about 'ref_images' vs 'ref_masks'
troubleshooting.solution: Update to latest WanExperiments repo and ensure all nodes are updated

troubleshooting.problem: OutOfMemoryError after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Remove --fast flag from launch parameters and update WanVideoWrapper

troubleshooting.problem: SVI-shot not working with different segment shots
troubleshooting.solution: Use Kijai's version of svi-shot LoRA and ensure WanExperiments repo is installed

troubleshooting.problem: BlockSwap node glitching
troubleshooting.solution: Right click and select 'fix recreate'

troubleshooting.problem: Confetti artifacts in first frames
troubleshooting.solution: Usually related to LoRA or step size on schedule, try lowering shift parameter

troubleshooting.problem: Qwen Edit defaulting to original image
troubleshooting.solution: Switch from full model to fp8 quantization

troubleshooting.problem: KeyError: 'samples' when connecting WanAnimate samples to second sampler
troubleshooting.solution: Issue with samples output from WanAnimate not being compatible with standard sampler input

troubleshooting.problem: Sizes of tensors must match error with Fun Control model
troubleshooting.solution: Resolution mismatch - control video was 640x1024 but expected 1024x640, caused by DWPose resizing output

troubleshooting.problem: HuMo causing bad first frames and missing frames
troubleshooting.solution: Apply sampler fix that prevents padding at front - only pad/trim at end to preserve real motion

troubleshooting.problem: Grid noise in generated videos
troubleshooting.solution: Use more steps, lightx loras, disable sage attn, use 2.2 low noise + lightning or lightx2v

troubleshooting.problem: Bright red colors appearing in videos
troubleshooting.solution: Remove lighting-related terms from prompts, may be caused by too many frames for wan 2.2 or fire scenes amplifying colors

troubleshooting.problem: VACE reference image causing tensor size mismatch
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure all images, control masks, and videos have same resolution, width, height and frame count

troubleshooting.problem: FlashVSR PTXASError on Blackwell GPU with 'sm_121a' not defined
troubleshooting.solution: Set environment variables TORCH_COMPILE_BACKEND=eager and TRITON_PTXAS_PATH in ComfyUI startup

troubleshooting.problem: start_step must be less than end_step error when using denoise parameter
troubleshooting.solution: Either use denoise OR start_step, not both. Set denoise to 1.0 and use start_step/end_step instead

troubleshooting.problem: Incomplete/broken video when starting sampling at higher step numbers
troubleshooting.solution: Enable 'add noise to samples' in the high noise sampler when doing partial steps

troubleshooting.problem: VACE inpainting not working - mask being ignored
troubleshooting.solution: Bake the mask into the original video as grey areas rather than using mask separately. Can also try inverting mask due to wrapper vs native polarity differences

troubleshooting.problem: First frame flashing/artifacts in Wan 2.2 first-last frame workflows
troubleshooting.solution: Enable 'add noise to samples' toggle as Wan 2.2 acts like FL2V model

troubleshooting.problem: HuMo causing severe color drift when replacing 2.1 LN
troubleshooting.solution: Don't combine FF2LF and HuMo embeds - separate conditioning to HN and LN respectively

troubleshooting.problem: Context windows not working with Wan-specific node
troubleshooting.solution: Use non-Wan context windows node with dim==2 instead of Wan-specific version

troubleshooting.problem: Wrapper OOMing on 17 frames
troubleshooting.solution: Enable blockswap, clear triton cache, disable torch compile, or reduce resolution

troubleshooting.problem: HuMo making lips flap constantly
troubleshooting.solution: Use lip sync suppress node or adjust audio scale settings

troubleshooting.problem: First frame flash in HuMo generations
troubleshooting.solution: Discard first few frames and use overlap with 5 frames, replacing start frames with clean end frames from previous generation

troubleshooting.problem: CLIPVisionLoader error 'clip_vision_h.safetensors' not in list
troubleshooting.solution: Need to add the clip_vision_h.safetensors model to the clip vision folder and select it in the loader node

troubleshooting.problem: Instant OOM issue with wrapper
troubleshooting.solution: Remove --async-offload flag. The more you offload with blockswap, the worse it gets

troubleshooting.problem: KeyError: 'randomref_embedding_pose.0.weight' with svi-dance
troubleshooting.solution: Need to load the unianimate lora on the model loader, not the set node, because it patches the model too

troubleshooting.problem: Context windows causing 'bad first frames' in HuMo
troubleshooting.solution: Change sampler to pad/trim at the end instead of front to preserve real frames and avoid garbage at start

troubleshooting.problem: Native offloading issues
troubleshooting.solution: Add --reserve-vram flag for few gigabytes. Issues caused by custom nodes breaking automatic offloading or Windows VRAM fluctuations

troubleshooting.problem: Shared GPU memory usage causing extreme slowdowns (100+ s/it)
troubleshooting.solution: Set Nvidia control panel to 'prefer no sysmem fallback', check task manager for processes using shared GPU memory, comment out PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF environment variable

troubleshooting.problem: Native Wan block swap node crashes ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Node is deprecated and blocked because it never worked properly and breaks newer offloading features. Use --reserve-vram 2 instead

troubleshooting.problem: HuMo audio encoder errors on fresh ComfyUI install
troubleshooting.solution: Use Scruffy's fixed Humo node from WanExperiments repo which allows multiple image references instead of just one

troubleshooting.problem: Context windows WF requires updated ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Use Kijai's context windows PR branch with git commands: git fetch origin pull/10975/head:pr-10975, git checkout pr-10975, git merge --no-edit master

troubleshooting.problem: Poor HuMo lip sync with custom audio
troubleshooting.solution: Check audio quality with Preview Audio node, use detailed prompts describing speech patterns, run vocals through separator first

troubleshooting.problem: Browser tab visibility slowing generation
troubleshooting.solution: Minimize browser tab or use remote setup, hardware acceleration in browser uses 500-1000MB VRAM

troubleshooting.problem: Black screens at 720x720 with comfy_chunked
troubleshooting.solution: Revert to wrapper version 1.3.9 or switch back to using 'comfy' instead of 'comfy_chunked'

troubleshooting.problem: OOM errors after updates
troubleshooting.solution: Complete ComfyUI reinstall can resolve persistent OOM issues that occur every 18 seconds

troubleshooting.problem: Out of RAM errors with block swap
troubleshooting.solution: Swap less blocks and/or disable the non-blocking on the block swap node

troubleshooting.problem: AudioEncoderEncode crashes on torch 2.9
troubleshooting.solution: Downgrade to torch 2.8 to fix flash attention compatibility issues

troubleshooting.problem: Sampling artifacts with different shift values
troubleshooting.solution: Keep the same shift value across all samplers in chain sampling - shift defines the schedule for entire sampling process

troubleshooting.problem: LoRA key not loaded errors with LightX2V on Wan 2.2
troubleshooting.solution: Remove incompatible keys from LoRA file using Python script, or use --verbose CRITICAL flag to suppress console output

troubleshooting.problem: Context windowing artifacts
troubleshooting.solution: Works best with controlled backgrounds, single frame masks, or strong controls like VACE. Limited to specific circumstances

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL frame range restriction around 600 frames causing errors
troubleshooting.solution: Set per_batch to a frame count you can handle so it doesn't try to do it all at once

troubleshooting.problem: VRAM stalling with GGUF Q5 models in WanVideoWrapper
troubleshooting.solution: Increase block swap amount (e.g., to 30) to prevent stalling

troubleshooting.problem: Time To Move high noise sampler only doing 1 step when using 4 total steps
troubleshooting.solution: TTM skips first step like vid2vid, so with 4 total steps split at center and TTM skip, high noise does 2 steps but appears as 1

troubleshooting.problem: Glitched out fingers and infinitely long fingers in SCAIL
troubleshooting.solution: Try blurring the input image a bit to reduce artifacts

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI Desktop app cannot install certain custom nodes
troubleshooting.solution: Consider using portable or venv installation instead

troubleshooting.problem: Exposure gain at beginning of frame batches and loss at end
troubleshooting.solution: Use WASWanExposureStabilizer node which averages luminance gains from stable middle batch and applies fixes to beginning/end frames

troubleshooting.problem: CUBLAS_STATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR with SCAIL
troubleshooting.solution: Update triton-windows package - issue fixed in October for older GPUs and fp8 e4m3fn

troubleshooting.problem: Torch compile not working with fp8 wan models on RTX 3090
troubleshooting.solution: Update triton-windows or change RMS norm mode to 'pytorch' in model loader for pytorch 2.9+

troubleshooting.problem: Wan2.1 workflows generating noise after first generation
troubleshooting.solution: Clear torch and cuda cache, update to pytorch 2.9.1 or newer

troubleshooting.problem: LongCat Avatar bf16 model OOM on 4090
troubleshooting.solution: Disable 'keep_model_in_vram' option in model loader

troubleshooting.problem: RTX 5090 significant performance drop in multi-window SCAIL
troubleshooting.solution: Try switching use_non_blocking to false in WanVideo BlockSwap and increase blocks_to_swap

troubleshooting.problem: Video combine only runs once instead of looping after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Need to find setting to fix looping behavior

troubleshooting.problem: Draw faces option in SCAIL-Pose only applies to main subject
troubleshooting.solution: Bug confirmed and fixed by Kijai

troubleshooting.problem: ComfyUI workflow crashes saying 'Reconnecting' and 'press any key to continue' during SVI Pro second ksampler
troubleshooting.solution: Use Clear VRAM node after first ksampler - it's an OOM issue

troubleshooting.problem: WanVideoSampler 'vace_blocks.8.modulation' error with fp8 models
troubleshooting.solution: Use bf16 versions instead, the base model there is 1.3B

troubleshooting.problem: Old workflow with start_step bug
troubleshooting.solution: Set the start_step again in the sampler node, it's a comfy bug that doesn't see it as 0

troubleshooting.problem: Missing SVI Pro node after update
troubleshooting.solution: Do git pull from nightly after uninstalling and reinstalling - nodes.py wasn't updating

troubleshooting.problem: SCAIL detection phase hard locking PC
troubleshooting.solution: Keep detection around 15fps, reducing resolution helps more than reducing frame rate

troubleshooting.problem: mat1 and mat2 shapes error with gguf text encoders
troubleshooting.solution: Try loading the gguf model into regular model loader and using regular clip

troubleshooting.problem: ClipLoaderGGUF error 'only 0-dimensional arrays can be converted to Python scalars'
troubleshooting.solution: Update gguf custom node, there are compatibility issues with recent ComfyUI updates

troubleshooting.problem: Crop/uncrop VACE inpainting showing seams and quality degradation
troubleshooting.solution: Add more padding of unmasked area, use bigger sampling area, composite back with grow mask and border blending

troubleshooting.problem: SM89 kernel not available error on Linux
troubleshooting.solution: SageAttention setup used wrong GPU spec when compiling - needs recompilation with correct GPU specifications

troubleshooting.problem: Recent ComfyUI versions causing huge memory use increase with Wan
troubleshooting.solution: Revert to ComfyUI commit 2e9d51680a90bca9cc375ba7767f7bf3ed27d563 from 3 weeks ago

troubleshooting.problem: Sudden OOM issues in ComfyUI
troubleshooting.solution: Remove --fast and --use-sage-attention flags, add --disable-pinned-memory and --reserve-vram 2

troubleshooting.problem: AttributeError: 'WanVideoModel' object has no attribute 'diffusion_model' after ComfyUI update
troubleshooting.solution: Revert to ComfyUI commit 4064062e7d2d5abdca6767b6944e331b70065ee8 or update wrapper (fixed by Kijai)

comparisons.verdict: VitPose is larger model, uncertain which is better overall, but VitPose works better for retargeting
Sapiens is probably the best pose estimation model currently available

comparisons.comparison: WIP WanAnimate workflow vs example workflow
comparisons.verdict: WIP workflow with preprocessor gives substantially better quality, better faces, no artifacts
UniAnimate still wins with pose handling
Difference is not major, only noticeable when specifically looking for it, not worth chasing unless doing final polish

comparisons.comparison: Kijai's workflow vs native WanAnimate workflow
comparisons.verdict: Kijai's works several times better, only native advantage is better cleanup of backplate (removal of old character)
12 fps better for consistency, 24 fps has awkward cuts and pose failures

comparisons.comparison: RGB vs pose input for WanAnimate
comparisons.verdict: RGB works for problematic scenes with FG elements, loses likeness slightly vs pose

comparisons.comparison: Anisora without loras vs with loras
comparisons.verdict: Better likeness and quality without loras, distillation is baked in so adding distill lora causes burning

comparisons.comparison: FP8 vs GGUF models on 30xx cards
comparisons.verdict: FP8_e5m2 gives better action, loads dual model (19GB each HN/LN) reaching 720p on 3060 12GB
Better action from FP8 in wrapper than GGUF in native in 99% of cases
Best quality audio to video but worst length of generations

comparisons.comparison: Native vs Wrapper model loading speed
comparisons.verdict: Native is actually faster, wrapper appears faster due to unmerged LoRAs

comparisons.comparison: AniSora 3.2 vs Lightning for animated content
comparisons.verdict: AniSora 3.2 distillation may be far better than lightning for animated content
Full Lynx makes huge difference, lite only does face ID while full does reference with larger IP adapter applied on crossattn on all blocks
WanAnimate isn't great at character consistency, nothing like VACE in 2.1

comparisons.comparison: Distill LoRAs vs full CFG generations
comparisons.verdict: 90% of cases distill LoRAs produce better results than 50-step CFG generations

comparisons.comparison: WanAnimate vs VACE for character swaps
comparisons.verdict: WanAnimate possibly better than VACE for simple swaps and accuracy, but VACE does more than just swaps
HuMo seems better overall, Lynx head looks pasted into video like PuLID

comparisons.comparison: Lynx full model vs lite version
comparisons.verdict: Lite version works better despite being much smaller - full model IP adapter doesn't seem effective
Nothing you couldn't already do with just VACE or Phantom. Currently not worth anything on its own

comparisons.comparison: GGUF vs fp8 for 3000 series GPUs
comparisons.verdict: Kijai recommends using GGUF on 3000 series. GGUF has slight quality advantage normally

comparisons.comparison: 20 steps CFG 5.0 vs 6 steps CFG 1.0 WanAnimate
comparisons.verdict: Both tested, 20 steps version had issues with jerky motion
Works well for camera pans left/right and zoom in/out, but not as good for camera rotation around a person. Needs version compatible with 2.2
Different results - HUMO provides better acting/facial expressions, InfiniteTalk enables long generation. Mixed together works better than either alone

comparisons.comparison: GGUF Q8 vs FP8 quality on Wan
comparisons.verdict: Wan has bigger quality hit from fp8 than QwenImage, GGUF Q8 should only be slightly slower and better quality
LightX2V + FastWan 2 steps: 31.49s, LightX2V 4 steps: 70.63s, LightX2V + FastWan 4 steps: 50.29s
Barely any difference for T2V, more difference for I2V
LCM burns less VRAM and is more natural, DPM++_SDE may be too much
Some OVI gens better than WAN 2.5 480p, better speech quality
VACE allows specific control not achievable without it, better quality than FUN

comparisons.comparison: OVI vs Wan 2.2 Animate + Infinite Talk
comparisons.verdict: OVI generates audio automatically but Wan 2.2 Animate + Infinite Talk may be better quality for lip-sync scenarios
OVI looks more real than 2.2 14B due to audio addition making motion more realistic
SLG 11 has better expression, SLG 7,8,9 has more background motion and better audio
rCM makes movements faster similar to base model, LightX2V makes movements much slower
Turbo is bad, fastwan is amazing according to tests
Local great quality, some ways better apart from lighting issues

comparisons.comparison: Clip embeds vs no clip embeds in WanAnimate
comparisons.verdict: With clip embeds: better identity but worse lighting. Without: better lighting but worse identity
rCM always gives subject some hair, lightx2v more stable

comparisons.comparison: New 2.2 MoE lora vs old 2.1 lora at higher strength
comparisons.verdict: Not convinced new lora is better than using old 2.1 lora at higher strength
SeedVR2 comparable quality but more VRAM hungry, FlashVSR much faster at 1 step

comparisons.comparison: FlashVSR performance on faces vs other elements
comparisons.verdict: Great for clothes, horses, trees but struggles with small distant faces, can make them worse
2.9 fixes compile issues that 2.8 had, but requires CUDA 13.0 and updated drivers
SageAttention makes inference faster but doesn't reduce memory usage significantly, SDPA more stable
Slightly different randomness, wrapper shows bird sitting in air while native has it properly positioned. One run isn't enough sample size to determine quality differences

comparisons.comparison: FlashVSR on already high-res vs low-res content
comparisons.verdict: FlashVSR meant for 4x upscaling from very low res. Using on 1280x768 produces blurry results with over-sharpening. Better for initial low-res to mid-res upscaling
MoCha has better eye movement and lighting control but uses double compute and no pose detection needed
ID isn't as good as VACE 2.1/Animate but lighting is super impressive
Context doesn't deteriorate over time but slower with window continuation issues on backgrounds
Animate needs to mask entire video and is faster, Mocha only needs first frame masked but is slower. Quality is subjective based on use case
Krea delivers higher visual quality and temporal stability but lacks fine-grained control. StreamDiffusion gives more tweakability but temporal consistency is challenging
VACE tends to morph images between keyframes while WAN 2.2 provides better actual animation movement
MoCha is better at placing subject in scene but has vague identity preservation due to lower Wan 2.1 base quality. WAN Animate has better identity preservation

comparisons.comparison: Native WAN vs Wrapper loading times
comparisons.verdict: Native WAN takes 13 seconds to load while wrapper takes 2 seconds
Light VAE is significantly faster, especially on high resolution, but has quality loss. Good for testing and low VRAM situations.
Lightning4step makes everything super bright and fake looking. LightX2V is more realistic but colors are washed out with some detail loss.

comparisons.comparison: ComfyUI new vs old cache system
comparisons.verdict: New version uses more RAM, reduced frame capacity from 97 to 69 frames at 1024x1024 with same settings

comparisons.comparison: RCM vs no LoRA for I2V
comparisons.verdict: RCM improves prompt following but burns out I2V outputs more
MoCha gives better integration into scenes but worse image quality, feels like CGI from a few years ago
PROs: better results for realistic settings, marginally better than QIE with no LoRAs. CONs: generation time for video instead of single image, difficult for high-res editing
Wan 2.2 much better - 5B vs 14B, no chance for Ovi

comparisons.comparison: Native tiled VAE vs wrapper tiled VAE performance
comparisons.verdict: Native performs much better - 83 seconds vs 18+ minutes for same task

comparisons.comparison: Ubuntu vs WSL2 vs Windows for model loading
comparisons.verdict: Ubuntu fastest, then WSL2, then Windows for model loading times
InfiniteTalk is better, especially for longer generations. S2V had pose control but burned out eventually and wasn't infinite

comparisons.comparison: Native Bindweave with vs without embeddings
comparisons.verdict: Best output was without the annoying embeddings (CLIP Vision and QwenVL) that took forever to implement

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.2 HN vs Wan 2.1 FLF as first pass
comparisons.verdict: Results vary by case - sometimes FLF is better, sometimes HN performs better for the same content
Wrapper produces significantly better quality results than native implementation
I2V is known for better quality than T2V
2.2 is known for better motion than 2.1
TimeToMove works better for hand-drawn animation interpolation, VACE tries to morph frames too literally
VACE 2.2 module is bad, use VACE 2.1 with Wan 2.2 models instead

comparisons.comparison: T2V quantile 0.15 LoRA vs I2V LoRA for I2V workflows
comparisons.verdict: T2V quantile 0.15 version is smoother and better without oversharpening, though some may consider it overkill at 2GB
HuMo has more motion and better lip sync/subject replication, but InfiniteTalk is designed for long duration generations. HuMo requires creative workflows for longer videos
S2V does extensions natively with less struggle, but not as good as InfiniteTalk for long videos or HuMo for lip sync and expressiveness

comparisons.comparison: HuMo vs InfiniteTalk for lip sync
comparisons.verdict: HuMo's motion and lipsync is better by a mile. InfiniteTalk ends up stiff, feels pasted on. HuMo is more body-aware and lifelike

comparisons.comparison: HuMo vs FFGO for multiple references
comparisons.verdict: HuMo beats FFGO. FFGO is hacky - forces all references into one white background frame vs HuMo's native multi-reference support
Wrapper is better - supports multiple reference images correctly while native was coded wrong and only uses one
Wrapper users complain native doesn't work, native users complain they can't use wrapper. Wrapper manually sets memory management while native uses torch functions
HunyuanVideo has better consistency but much slower than Wan for same/worse quality in quick i2v tests

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.1 VACE vs Fun VACE 2.2 for low-noise
comparisons.verdict: Wan 2.1 VACE performs better on low-noise side, more natural and integrated results

comparisons.comparison: Wan 2.2 High + HuMo Low vs HuMo only
comparisons.verdict: 2.2 combo provides better motion and prompt adherence, character reference works less well but can be improved with better prompting

comparisons.comparison: WanMove vs Wan 2.1 I2V VRAM usage
comparisons.verdict: WanMove doesn't increase VRAM use at all from Wan 2.1 I2V, sampling part is identical
