Context windowing generates whole video at once while extension methods continue from last frame(s) - fundamentally different approaches
GGUF Q5 somewhat slower than fp8 but not drastically, sdpa attention mode is lot slower than sageattn

comparisons.comparison: vitpose-H vs dwpose for pose detection
comparisons.verdict: vitpose-H generally better than dwpose but only does one person while dwpose can do multiple
Same Q5 models run much faster in native workflow (few minutes) vs WanVideoWrapper (can take 51 minutes)
Maybe 10-20% speed boost, not huge difference
WanAnimate better for facial animation/dialogue, SCAIL better for multiple characters and advanced motion
Essentially repackaging of existing techniques like sage attention, speed LoRAs, quantization - maybe 2x faster than current optimizations
SCAIL delivers better quality for movement but doesn't have good long gen system like Animate
SteadyDancer accurately reproduces faces but always has glitches, OneToAll barely reproduces the face

comparisons.comparison: fp8 vs GGUF for VACE workflows
comparisons.verdict: fp8 e5m2 works better on 3060 setup than GGUFs for VACE 2.2 modules
SCAIL better for movements/pose copying, LTX 2 better for facial consistency and skin quality
MOVA looks better than HuMo, but no direct comparison possible since MOVA is unified model while HuMo requires audio input

tips.tip: Cover entire character with mask, better too much than too little
tips.context: When using WanAnimate masking

tips.tip: Disable relight LoRA for 2D characters
tips.context: Often has negative effect on more stylized/2D characters

tips.tip: Use larger face references and higher resolutions
tips.context: For better character similarity in WanAnimate

tips.tip: Prompting helps with object handling
tips.context: When model struggles with objects like swords, better prompting about how character handles object can help

tips.tip: Match frame rate to your input video
tips.context: Model is 16fps but should match input video frame rate

tips.tip: Use Load Video from Path node for large videos
tips.context: Has no size limitations unlike upload node

tips.tip: Prompt everything you can including eye color for better character consistency
tips.context: When getting different characters in generations

tips.tip: Make masks larger and blocky for more freedom in character shape
tips.context: Mask shape forces character shape a lot

tips.tip: Use face crop improvement and proper pose estimation for better output
tips.context: dwpose is too thick in general, model expects specific pose format

tips.tip: Start with higher CFG (3.5) for first steps to improve motion, then lower to 1
tips.context: Using CFG scheduling with lightx2v lora for faster generation

tips.tip: For v2v with video input, use denoise 0.35 or 0.50 on high model
tips.context: When using video input with Wan models

tips.tip: Use v2v method with H+L models: 0.35 denoise, 2 steps instead of start/end step
tips.context: For passing high model output to low model

tips.tip: Activate 'use video input v2v' setting when doing video to video
tips.context: Needed for proper v2v workflow

tips.tip: For WanAnimate masking with wrapper, supply masks and input frames with masked area colorized to grey
tips.context: Using VACE with masks

tips.tip: Disconnect both background images and masks when doing full scene replace in WanAnimate
tips.context: To animate just the character without background constraints

tips.tip: Always go with wrapper since it has more speed and allows more testing
tips.context: Choosing between wrapper and native workflows

tips.tip: For InfiniteTalk frame rate sync: interpolate WanAnimate 16fps to 32fps, then load at 25fps for InfiniteTalk
tips.context: Syncing different frame rates between models

tips.tip: Use prompting for motion in WanAnimate
tips.context: When background isn't moving even with control inputs

tips.tip: Use remap mask range for better background blending
tips.context: When subject doesn't blend well with background

tips.tip: Don't use distillation LoRAs with models that already have distillation baked in
tips.context: When using pre-distilled models

tips.tip: Use face crop instead of full frame for Lynx reference
tips.context: When using Lynx reference adapter

tips.tip: Connect infinitetalk only to high model in 2.2
tips.context: When trying to use infinitetalk with Wan 2.2

tips.tip: Use Chinese negative prompts for better results
tips.context: Chinese prompts may produce significantly different and potentially better results than English translations

tips.tip: Avoid masking in character replacement
tips.context: Masking tries to fit person in shape of other person and reduces consistency

tips.tip: Lower pose and face strength for difficult swaps
tips.context: When swapping between very different body types (like Trump to thin woman), reduce control strengths

tips.tip: Use 256x256 face crops for reference adapters
tips.context: Original implementations crop faces to 256x256 for reference adapters

tips.tip: Generic wan negative prompts often don't help
tips.context: The standard negative prompts used in examples may not actually improve results most of the time

tips.tip: Use empty wall prompting and negative prompts
tips.context: To prevent unwanted objects appearing in background during character animation

tips.tip: Use HuMo with InfiniteTalk for long generation

tips.tip: Adjust frame_window_size parameter when generating specific frame counts
tips.context: When generating 81 frames, make sure to adjust frame_window_size in Wanvideo Animate Embeds Node to prevent video looping

tips.tip: Use context options for long video upscaling
tips.context: For upscaling 400+ frame videos without running out of VRAM/RAM

tips.tip: Use VACE for long video clip seam fixing
tips.context: Split around seam, patch with grey frames and white masks for frames to fix, black mask for untouched frames

tips.tip: Mix HUMO and InfiniteTalk embeds using WanVideo Combine Embeds node
tips.context: Put HuMo Embeds first, InfiniteTalk second for improved results

tips.tip: For dialogue use cases, try mixing IT and HUMO
tips.context: Helps fight unwanted mouth movements and improves facial emotion expression

tips.tip: Use tiling option to reduce VRAM reservation
tips.context: Tiling lowered reserved VRAM from 17.47GB to 6.22GB for VAE operations

tips.tip: Prompt location setting for consistent backgrounds
tips.context: Prompt 'video is filmed in nightclub' to keep all video in same location

tips.tip: Keep prompts simple for WAN Animate to reduce artifacts
tips.context: Use ChatGPT to describe reference image then strip to bare minimum

tips.tip: Reference images work better when facing camera
tips.context: For better likeness preservation in WAN Animate

tips.tip: Use replace images in batch instead of inject latent for previewing sequences
tips.context: For previewing frame injection workflows like VACE

tips.tip: Use speech and audio tags as specified in OVI paper
tips.context: Speech format: <S>text<E>, audio guidance with <AUDCAP>description<ENDAUDCAP>

tips.tip: Use same LoRA twice on both high and low noise models
tips.context: When using LoRAs with Wan 2.2

tips.tip: Use 256 rank LoRA at 2.5 strength on high noise model
tips.context: For best t2v results

tips.tip: Use Flux resolution calculator for Wan
tips.context: When finding correct resolution

tips.tip: Use prompt structure with <S> and <E> tags
tips.context: Mandatory for OVI as both models use same prompt

tips.tip: Add commas and ellipses for small pauses
tips.context: For better audio timing in OVI

tips.tip: DPM++ sampler with lower CFG (3) works well for realistic people
tips.context: OVI generation settings

tips.tip: Start SLG later rather than full range
tips.context: Better results than using full range like original code

tips.tip: Use merged LoRAs for stronger effect
tips.context: Merged loras are stronger than using base + lora

tips.tip: Switch VHS node output from webm to mp4
tips.context: webm has compatibility issues on various platforms

tips.tip: Use 50 steps minimum for proper results
tips.context: Lower steps like 20 cause visual issues and added words

tips.tip: Use higher shift around 8 for OVI
tips.context: Helps with quality, affects audio as well

tips.tip: Change OVI audio cfg to 4.5
tips.context: Same as used in mmaudio, seems to improve results

tips.tip: Make sure no groups are disabled when using audio workflows
tips.context: For proper autoqueuing of generations

tips.tip: Prompt has huge impact on OVI results
tips.context: Can get garbled mess but then perfect results by changing one or two words with same seed

tips.tip: Use strength 0.8 to reduce oversharpening
tips.context: FlashVSR default can be too sharp

tips.tip: FlashVSR works best with really low quality inputs
tips.context: Their examples are from 384x384 resolution

tips.tip: Match input frame count with num_frames setting
tips.context: To avoid frame processing issues

tips.tip: Process at lower resolution first, then upscale
tips.context: Perform inference at lower res for speed, then upscale with FlashVSR, then final upscale with wan for killer combo

tips.tip: Use smaller context window to reduce VRAM usage
tips.context: 48 frame context instead of full 85 frames reduces VRAM at cost of small glitch in middle

tips.tip: Apply slight temperature change for color correction
tips.context: To counteract the browning effect FlashVSR causes

tips.tip: Resize reference image to match wan output resolution
tips.context: Feeding 1080p reference to 720p wan output takes more VRAM

tips.tip: Clear triton caches after updates
tips.context: Especially after comfy code updates to prevent compilation issues

tips.tip: Use --reserve-vram 2 on Windows with monitor on same GPU
tips.context: Helps prevent OOM when display uses same GPU as ComfyUI

tips.tip: Convert git-managed custom nodes for easy updates
tips.context: Use git init, add remote, fetch, checkout to enable git pull updates

tips.tip: Test new torch versions on separate ComfyUI install
tips.context: Avoid breaking working setup when testing bleeding edge versions

tips.tip: Use total pixel scaling for GPU VRAM constraints
tips.context: When GPU can only handle specific total pixels (like 600,000 pixels max), calculate resolution ratios to stay within limits while preserving aspect ratio

tips.tip: Blur footage slightly before upscaling with FlashVSR
tips.context: Gives the upscaler more room to work, at cost of not keeping exactly the original

tips.tip: Resolution is about signal to noise ratio, not just pixel count
tips.context: A file marked as 1280x720 doesn't mean it was captured/rendered at that resolution. Real quality depends on how 'noisy' each frame is compared to signal

tips.tip: Start with base Wan 2.2 models before trying fine-tunes
tips.context: Base model is still king, unlike SDXL/SD1.5 where base models weren't very capable

tips.tip: Use LoRAs for NSFW content instead of full model merges
tips.context: Video models are hard to make complete new merges for, but LoRAs work fine for NSFW applications

tips.tip: Use slightly larger tile dimensions than exact factors
tips.context: For tiling, dimensions slightly larger than exact factors of original image make overlap work more efficiently

tips.tip: Use Linux to avoid low level torch/triton problems
tips.context: Windows triton has limitations

tips.tip: Set force_offload to true on samplers to free memory
tips.context: Memory is freed right after sampler finishes

tips.tip: Second run indicates torch compile benefit
tips.context: First run includes compiling so can be slower

tips.tip: Use converted LoRAs instead of native VACE module to save VRAM
tips.context: Native module is bf16, converted gives almost identical results

tips.tip: Two reference images work better than one
tips.context: Can provide close up of face and full body so you don't have to pick

tips.tip: Use 'human' in negative prompt for non-human characters
tips.context: When generating non-human character animations, always add 'human' to negative prompt

tips.tip: Don't use FP8 on text encoder nodes unless absolutely necessary
tips.context: FP8 on text encoder nodes has no memory footprint benefit and shouldn't be used unless VRAM is extremely limited

tips.tip: Disable relight LoRAs for better character likeness
tips.context: When trying to maintain character consistency and likeness to reference image

tips.tip: Use res_2s/bong tangent samplers for better realism
tips.context: Slower but delivers better results in general, though not available in wrapper currently

tips.tip: Disable LightX LoRA but keep WanAnimate relight LoRA
tips.context: When not using LightX acceleration, keep relight LoRA enabled to avoid burnt/orange video appearance

tips.tip: Use higher resolution for better identity preservation
tips.context: Higher resolution makes biggest difference with preserving identity, especially for character likeness

tips.tip: Match reference image pose and size to driving video
tips.context: Reference image should show person in similar pose and size to driving video person to avoid big mismatches

tips.tip: Continue from last 5 frames with film LoRAs
tips.context: When using film LoRAs for longer videos, continue generation from last 5 frames of previous generation

tips.tip: Use HuMo i2v model patcher for embedded mask manipulation
tips.context: For SVI and dialogue replacement workflows

tips.tip: Generate with 2.2 first, then use HuMo/InfiniteTalk for lip sync
tips.context: For difficult shots requiring control - use total freedom in 2.2 generation, then V2V for lip sync

tips.tip: Save latent to disk between samplers to reduce RAM usage
tips.context: When second sampler uses significantly more RAM than first

tips.tip: Use MagRef for low pass instead of standard Wan 2.2 low
tips.context: Preserves more detail from input I2V image and creates less context artifacts

tips.tip: Cut off last few frames of previous generation for better lipsync transitions
tips.context: When creating clips to stitch together, words landing between clips cause weirdness

tips.tip: Face should take up 1/3 of frame at 544p-720p for best lipsync results
tips.context: When not practical, generate at lower resolution then detail the face at higher resolution with 0.5 denoise

tips.tip: Use overlapping frames for any video consistency
tips.context: Need overlapping frames to get consistency when stitching video segments

tips.tip: Reduce LoRA strength to remove blurry spots
tips.context: When Krea LoRA adds extra details but creates blur

tips.tip: Reduce window size to fit higher resolutions in LongCat
tips.context: Can reduce from 81 frames to 77 or even 66 frames to accommodate higher resolution generations

tips.tip: Use larger face regions for HuMo inpainting
tips.context: Crop image, blow face up to high res, denoise, then paste back into original video

tips.tip: Use 960x960 resolution for optimal results
tips.context: Model is trained for this resolution, higher resolutions may cause issues

tips.tip: Use 81 frames for best results
tips.context: Model is trained for 81 frames, other frame counts may not work as well

tips.tip: Use gamma exposure operation to handle color shift
tips.context: For dealing with continuation color shift issues in long generations

tips.tip: Use SDPA instead of SageAttn for better quality
tips.context: When generating still images with Wan 2.2

tips.tip: Use middle gray (127,127,127 RGB) for solid frames
tips.context: For I2V conditioning frames that should be generated

tips.tip: Use umt5-xxl-fp16.safetensors instead of umt-xxl-enc-bf16.safetensors
tips.context: The 'enc' version only works with WanVideoWrapper, remove 'enc' for native ComfyUI

tips.tip: Pressure on mouse when sending matters for generation quality
tips.context: Technique for getting good results

tips.tip: Can disrupt SVI reference frame bias by changing reference frames, SVI LoRA strength, or reference latent strength
tips.context: When SVI-shot keeps head tilted based on reference frame

tips.tip: Use custom sigmas with shift 1.0 to prevent morphing from turning into fade
tips.context: For maintaining dynamic morphs instead of fades in video generation

tips.tip: Set shift to 50 to stay in 1-0.875 timestep range for LoRA training
tips.context: When using LoRAs trained with TREAD in that specific range

tips.tip: Remove lightning LoRA and use full 20-30 steps for better Qwen Edit results
tips.context: When lightning LoRA causes issues with image editing

tips.tip: Use video and mask it like Animate for InfiniteTalk v2v
tips.context: For masked video-to-video with InfiniteTalk

tips.tip: Use fp32 VAE for better results
tips.context: Can be loaded in ComfyUI for improved quality

tips.tip: Use mid gray frames (127,127,127 RGB) after first frame for HuMo
tips.context: Helps reduce flashing issues when using HuMo

tips.tip: Use headshot of character for better HuMo results
tips.context: Model performs better when it can see character clearly from front

tips.tip: Check resolution with Get Size & Count node
tips.context: Useful for debugging tensor size mismatch errors

tips.tip: Use eta 1.0 on sampler settings for HuMo fix
tips.context: Part of configuration to reduce flashing issues

tips.tip: Use Load Audio node from Video Helper Suite for audio trimming
tips.context: Has seek parameter and duration value for selecting specific parts of audio for InfiniteTalk

tips.tip: Always set denoise to 1.0 and use start_step/end_step for clearer control
tips.context: In wrapper, denoise parameter can cause confusing situations

tips.tip: For VACE with OpenPose, use black background and blend with original video
tips.context: When combining multiple controls like mask and pose for VACE inpainting

tips.tip: Use Phantom on low stage for better resemblance in VACE workflows
tips.context: When doing character consistency in VACE inpainting

tips.tip: Use fractional denoising for Wan inpainting
tips.context: When using latent noise mask inpainting, use denoise < 1.0 like 0.6 or 0.7, or start at step > 0 in wrapper

tips.tip: Masks can be feathered or blurred
tips.context: Any Wan model mask can have values between 0 and 1 and be blurred, sometimes works better

tips.tip: Test samplers and schedulers separately
tips.context: When testing HuMo flash mitigation, constrain parameter space by testing one variable at a time to get meaningful results

tips.tip: Check model layers to see if clip vision is used
tips.context: Inspect model's HF layers - models without img_emb layers will ignore clip vision embeddings

tips.tip: Use full body reference images for HuMo
tips.context: If model has to guess missing parts (like pants), it will likely guess differently in longer clips causing inconsistencies

tips.tip: Describe reference images in prompts
tips.context: HuMo works better when you describe the reference images in the prompt, not just rely on the images alone

tips.tip: When in doubt with context windows: more overlap
tips.context: Increasing overlap from 30 to 50 helps blend context windows better

tips.tip: Use Load Multiple Images (batch) node for multiple references
tips.context: Best way to batch reference images for HuMo. Images don't need to be same size

tips.tip: For better 2.2 motion with HuMo: Run first few steps with Wan 2.2 HN using prompts to match target character, then let HuMo take over for remaining steps
tips.context: When combining 2.2 high noise with HuMo low noise for better motion + audio sync

tips.tip: Run inpainting pass on faces if they are small in HuMo videos
tips.context: Crop faces, upscale, sample with HuMo, paste back into original video for better results

tips.tip: Use detailed prompts for HuMo lip sync
tips.context: Instead of just 'talking', use descriptions like 'She very slowly says two words, separated by silence. After the first word she pauses and takes a breath'

tips.tip: Don't hook up HuMo node to sampler if not using HuMo model
tips.context: Only connect HuMo node when actually using the HuMo model in that sampler

tips.tip: Use depth maps instead of pose for sketchy drawings
tips.context: DW pose doesn't work well on drawings, but depth maps work surprisingly well for sketches

tips.tip: Test strength of WanVideo VACE encode
tips.context: Experiment with different encode strength values to find what works best for your content

tips.tip: Use 81 or 97 frames minimum for context windows
tips.context: Setting frames too low can cause weird results in context window sampling

tips.tip: Use 3-4 steps without LightX LoRA at start for better motion
tips.context: For T2V, adding initial steps without speed LoRA before main sampling improves dynamics

tips.tip: Use lower shift values with I2V (around 5)
tips.context: I2V generally works better with shift around 5, higher shift may be needed when not using distill LoRA

tips.tip: Keep prompts simple for MMAudio
tips.context: Over-prompting MMAudio makes it perform worse, simple prompts or no prompt work better

tips.tip: Use CFG 5.5 and negatives for better MMAudio results
tips.context: Higher CFG and negative prompts help reduce unwanted sounds and moaning

tips.tip: Match frame rates between video and MMAudio
tips.context: Ensuring frame rate matching is important for MMAudio to sync properly with video

tips.tip: Use not-quite black background for VACE Pose input
tips.context: Straight black backgrounds can cause issues with VACE pose conditioning

tips.tip: Monitor VRAM during ksampler - if you have 500+ mb free VRAM steps should warm up quickly
tips.context: For detecting VRAM issues, especially on cards like 2060

tips.tip: Use skip_final_model_call option to avoid context windows time stepping issues
tips.context: When using substep samplers with context windows, minimal output difference

tips.tip: Increasing resolution of subject in frame improves quality of subject transfer
tips.context: Can then insert the subject into target video later using traditional video editing

tips.tip: Use #202020 background color for better results
tips.context: Personal preference that has been working well lately

tips.tip: Always backup your venv and keep dev/production versions
tips.context: Before updating ComfyUI or making major changes

tips.tip: Use WanMove with spline editor for keyframe animation support
tips.context: Can span over several context windows for Time to Move

tips.tip: Default pose workflow ends at 0.5, increase to 1.0 to help with pose adherence
tips.context: When using SCAIL pose control

tips.tip: Match starting pose and composition for SCAIL animation
tips.context: Reference image should have similar starting pose as source animation

tips.tip: Use rank 512 for LoRA extraction and adjust strength above 1.0 for Wan 2.2 high
tips.context: WanMove LoRA extraction and usage

tips.tip: Set block 0 to 0.0 when using extracted LoRAs
tips.context: Reduces unwanted artifacts and improves coherence

tips.tip: Check RAM/VRAM usage if experiencing dramatic performance drops
tips.context: Multi-window SCAIL performance issues

tips.tip: Use both LoRAs for better motion accuracy
tips.context: When working with experimental motion LoRAs

tips.tip: Keep HuMo ref disconnected or set to very low strength
tips.context: It tends to snap image back to ref and interferes with motion

tips.tip: Lean into practically infinite canvas and make gigantic workflows rather than using loops
tips.context: Loops are fragile and don't allow stopping/starting partial executions

tips.tip: Use brute-force curation and feed VACE different 16-frame sets until it clicks
tips.context: For seamless video transitions

tips.tip: The tighter the crop to masked area, the more visible seams are
tips.context: VACE inpainting - add more padding for better results

tips.tip: Use --disable-pinned-memory flag for OOM issues
tips.context: When experiencing sudden out of memory problems in ComfyUI

tips.tip: Set NVIDIA driver CUDA sysmem fallback policy to 'Prefer NO sysmem fallback'
tips.context: For better performance in ComfyUI by preventing driver-level block swapping

tips.tip: Check Windows page file settings
tips.context: Make sure page file isn't too low for what ComfyUI is handling when experiencing performance issues

concepts.explanation: Adjusting pose proportions to match reference character dimensions, done automatically by VitPose in WanAnimate
WanAnimate uses block-based masking rather than pixel-perfect masks for easier generalization
WanAnimate automatically extends videos using 1-frame overlap between segments
0 = no scaling using original code, >0 = activates bounded crop. Not meant to be used with masking
Start with high CFG (3.5) for motion, then lower to 1. CFG needs 2nd pass through model so 1 step with CFG = 2 steps time-wise
Denoise just adjusts start step - it's alternative way to set it. Better to use actual start_step with low steps
Using denoise strength instead of start_step/end_step for model chaining
Using latent masks to control which areas of the image get modified during generation
Amount of noise added is based on sigmas of skipped steps, imitating noise of sigma schedule to fool model
Wan 2.2 uses separate expert models for high and low noise, bypassing this loses benefits of 14B model
Runs one step through model with reference image first, similar to oldschool ref only approach
Models trained to achieve similar results with fewer steps and lower cfg values
Multiple Set LoRA nodes stack their effects - if you set same LoRA with 0.5 strength twice, it becomes 1.0 total
noise_pred = noise_pred_uncond + cfg_scale * (noise_pred_cond - noise_pred_uncond)
Native implementation doesn't execute face adapter at all if nothing is connected, unlike wrapper
Sigmas operate on step size, not just values. The value used in math is (current sigma) - (next sigma). Higher sigma means more noise, lower means less noise. Normal sampling goes from high to low
In wrapper/diffusers denoise sets the start step. In ComfyUI native it also increases max steps to match step count. Fundamentally changes how much noise you start with
When sigma values go up instead of down, it adds noise instead of removing it, which is called unsampling
Memory optimization technique where weights don't need to fit GPU all at once, works for any architecture
Combining embeddings from different models (like HUMO + InfiniteTalk) for improved results

concepts.term: High noise vs Low noise models
concepts.explanation: Dual model approach where high noise model has better prompt adherence, low noise refines output
Face identity preservation system with IP adapter and reference adapter components, lite vs full versions
High/Low noise expert split in WAN 2.2, can use different models for different noise levels
OVI audio+video model requires sync at every step through shared cross attention
Default is 157 for 31 latents (121 image frames), can be adjusted for different video lengths
Must use <S> and <E> tags around speech, with <AUDCAP> and <ENDAUDCAP> for audio description
Audio extension approximately 30+1 per 8 seconds of video, 248 audio latent for 193 frames
Audio doesn't generate correctly after 157 latents or ~5 seconds, similar to other audio models
Anything above 1.0 cfg doubles compute time, 1.0 or below is half the compute time
Only 2.1 I2V model and loras have img_emb layers for clip vision embeds, 2.2 just doesn't use them (WanAnimate is exception)
Tiny decoder that uses LR frames as auxiliary inputs in addition to latents for HR reconstruction
Feature to process long videos in segments to manage memory usage
When torch encounters different tensor shapes or conditions, it recompiles the model. Too many recompiles hit a limit and cause memory issues
Cached compilation files stored on disk that can grow over time and cause issues if corrupted

concepts.term: Signal to noise ratio in video
concepts.explanation: Better metric than resolution - measures how 'noisy' each frame is compared to useful signal. A 1280x720 file doesn't necessarily mean it was captured at that resolution
Unlike SD1.5/SDXL checkpoints that bundled everything, Wan separates diffusion model, text encoder (CLIP), and VAE as individual components due to size constraints
Calculating resolution based on total pixel count while maintaining aspect ratio, useful for GPU VRAM limitations
Way to enable negative prompt when using CFG 1
Original frames concatenated along temporal dimension, requiring double the memory/compute
Weights loaded only when actually used, not instantly loaded to memory
Feature allowing you to provide starting images converted to latents for each context window in I2V generation
Images must have dimensions divisible by specified number (16 or 32) due to latent space requirements in the model
VACE variant that can add style and effects to videos without needing controlnet, just uses image input
Strong transition effects that appear in WAN Animation, causing degradation after third 77-frame iteration
Fun InP is for in-between frames (FFLF morphing), Fun Control is for ControlNet inputs like Canny, Depth, Pose
Using two VACE encoders - one for single image reference at high strength, another for video frames at lower strength for better control
Normalization scaling, not dimensional scaling. Native and wrapper do it at different times so node needed when using VAE from other implementation.
Setting that affects RAM usage - can cause crashes if insufficient RAM but provides performance benefits when working
New ComfyUI feature behind --fast flag that increases RAM usage but speeds up operations, may cause crashes
VACE can detect and incorporate motion patterns from raw video when control images are gradually modified to include video content
Phenomenon where I2V outputs become overexposed or degraded when certain LoRAs like RCM are applied
Using multiple lightning LoRAs (like 1030 and 1022) together with specific CFG and step settings for faster inference
T2V uses 16 channels for noise. I2V adds 20 more (36 total): channels 17-20 for mask, 21-36 for conditioning inputs
Wan models work with latent frames that each encode 4 real frames plus 1 extra, so use frame counts like 49, 53, etc.
Uses only 16 channels like T2V. VACE blocks are parallel set added to model that interact in complex ways
Adds reference image at end of regular noise latent, model understands this without extra blocks
SVI-shot prefers the reference frame positioning, keeping subjects in similar poses/angles as the reference
Noise on first few frames that makes transitions noticeable when extending videos
Unique parameter that augments empty frames with inverse of start image to force more motion
Specific LoRA model used in the low noise pass that significantly impacts quality and flashing issues
System using input frames and masks as separate conditioning data for video generation, allows precise control over which frames to preserve or generate
Wan compresses video by factor of 8 spatially and 4 temporally - helps understand tensor size errors
Artifacts caused when VAE encounters blurry latent data that's outside its training domain of normal sharp videos
Whether white or black pixels represent the masked area - different between wrapper and native implementations
In wrapper, denoise simply overrides start_step - denoise 0.8 with 10 steps means start at step 2
Unlike VACE where images can be inserted anywhere, I2V must respect 4+1 frames rule to avoid glitches like color shift or flashing
Using denoise < 1.0 or starting at step > 0 in wrapper, partially obliterates input samples with correct amount of noise
Extra dimension added to mask tensors to store masks for each frame when converting from pixel to latent space, also called temporal masks
Context length refers to latent frames, not pixel frames. 16 context = 16 latents = 64 actual frames
When HuMo adds reference images, it changes frame count. Before fix, sampler padded front with noise causing confetti. After fix, pads tail which gets cut off
Single line of code that modifies empty i2v channel latents to squeeze in more motion, like making car drive more exciting by driving on slippery ice - more dynamic but less controlled
Wan context windows node uses real frames not latent frames. First frame is special in Wan, encoded differently than subsequent frames
When shared GPU memory usage goes over 5%, GPU waits 99% of time for CPU, causing extreme slowdowns
Technique that converts blurred/feathered latent masks into series of increasing binary masks, simulating blur effect progressively
Mask sent through latent line that tells model there is no noise in unmasked regions, applied before being sent to model
Context windowing generates whole video at once, extension methods continue from last frames - fundamentally different approaches
Schedule created on first sampler carries through to others, like planning a road trip route that can't be changed mid-journey

concepts.term: Z-Image trick with Normal Map and High Pass
concepts.explanation: Enhancement process for second pass in MoE workflow, allows upscaling during same t2v pass
Don't return left over noise on high, use add noise on low, enables Z-Image enhancement
Creates skeleton for input image and moves it according to audio features like beat, bass, treble, mids and onset

concepts.term: Context windows vs internal technique in WanAnimate
concepts.explanation: Context windows won't degrade over time but has scene/background shift. Internal window won't shift much but degrades considerably after 3 extensions
ONNX format has 4GB file size limit requiring model to be split into .onnx and .bin files
Has to be reversed due to how the combining works - explicit mechanism is more robust than dynamic input widgets
1 latent equals 4 frames plus 1, so motion latent count of 2 needs overlap of 9
The sigma at which you transition from high noise model to low noise model (0.9 for I2V, 0.875 for T2V)
Using VACE to generate bridge sections between separately generated video clips

limitations.details: Flash artifacts occur because HuMo wasn't actually designed for I2V even though it works well

limitations.limitation: Subgraphs are buggy with get/set nodes
limitations.details: Links disconnect randomly, connect to wrong outputs when using subgraphs with get/set nodes

limitations.limitation: Frame count mismatch between models
limitations.details: Hard to go over 100 frames because HuMo needs 25 FPS but other models trained on 16 FPS

limitations.limitation: 5B model works poorly with multi-frame reference
limitations.details: Multi-frame reference approach doesn't work well with 5B model

limitations.limitation: Character consistency challenging with Wan
limitations.details: Difficult to maintain character consistency, especially for non-humanoid characters

limitations.limitation: VACE struggles with hand-drawn sketch interpolation
limitations.details: Tries to morph frames too literally instead of generating new frames matching animation style, works better with consistent objects/shapes

limitations.limitation: Fun models produce lower quality results
limitations.details: Fun Control and Fun VACE models don't achieve same quality as standard models

limitations.limitation: Painter node breaks HuMo lip sync
limitations.details: When using Painter as first pass, HuMo second pass doesn't produce lip sync movement

limitations.limitation: Native implementation quality issues
limitations.details: Native Wan 2.2 produces significantly lower quality than wrapper implementation

limitations.limitation: Context options remain obscure
limitations.details: Context windows approach for continuity is not well understood and not widely used, suggesting poor effectiveness

limitations.limitation: VACE 2.2 module quality issues
limitations.details: VACE 2.2 module performs poorly compared to VACE 2.1

limitations.limitation: Can't use both denoise and start_step parameters simultaneously
limitations.details: Will cause 'start_step must be less than end_step' error

limitations.limitation: 4-frame latent block constraint in I2V
limitations.details: Must respect 4+1 frames rule or get glitches like weird color shift or flashing

limitations.limitation: HuMo not designed for long duration generations
limitations.details: HuMo can work for longer videos but requires creative workflows, unlike InfiniteTalk which is built for long videos

limitations.limitation: HuMo color drift when replacing 2.1 LN
limitations.details: Same settings that work with 2.1 LN cause severe color drift when switching to HuMo, even without HuMo embeds

limitations.limitation: Context windows fundamental issue with start image
limitations.details: Camera can't really move and character can't leave frame when using start image with context windows

limitations.limitation: PainterLongVideo node is non-functional
limitations.details: Reference image and motion frames inputs don't work, reference_motion only used by S2V model, produces same results as single frame I2V

limitations.limitation: Context windows don't work with i2v channel stuff
limitations.details: Context windows incompatible with I2V conditioning channels and similar features

limitations.limitation: HuMo quality suffers with context windows
limitations.details: While technically possible, quality drops to same level as other models that already do long generation natively

limitations.limitation: Native HuMo implementation incomplete
limitations.details: Only uses one reference image instead of supporting multiple like the model actually can

limitations.limitation: Context windows cause background shifting
limitations.details: Every window uses same start image causing background inconsistencies, though less than usual with some models

limitations.limitation: Context windows cause character drift
limitations.details: Only first context window gets character references, subsequent windows ignore them causing identity loss

limitations.limitation: DW pose doesn't work well for drawings
limitations.details: Pose detection fails on non-real human subjects like sketches or animated characters

limitations.limitation: Resolution and upscaling issues for anime
limitations.details: Even working workflows look poor quality, no great way to upscale anime found

limitations.limitation: Frame rate inconsistencies between models
limitations.details: Models trained at different fps (16 vs 25) and even same models can go slow motion or fast unexpectedly

limitations.limitation: Wan 2.2 Fun VACE doesn't support 2.2 LoRAs
limitations.details: Built on 2.2 Fun architecture, not as flexible as 2.1 VACE for complex tasks

limitations.limitation: Context windowing artifacts in general use
limitations.details: Only works well with controlled backgrounds, static cameras, or strong controls like VACE. Limited applicability for general video generation

limitations.limitation: HuMo with SVI 2.2 compatibility issues
limitations.details: Couldn't make HuMo work properly with SVI 2.2, creates transition issues

limitations.limitation: Character reference degradation in multi-pass
limitations.details: Using Wan 2.2 + HuMo makes character reference work less well compared to single model use

limitations.limitation: Flash attention compatibility on RTX 5090
limitations.details: torch 2.9 flash attention doesn't support RTX 5090 capability (12,0) and float32 dtype

limitations.limitation: SCAIL only works for 81 frames natively
limitations.details: Anything beyond requires context windows with usual problems, full version will have extension method

limitations.limitation: SCAIL background shifts when camera moves away from original background
limitations.details: Not model fault, inherent limitation of the approach

limitations.limitation: Humo works better without traditional image embeds
limitations.details: It's a t2v model wearing an i2v model's skin

limitations.limitation: vitpose-H only does one person while dwpose can do multiple
limitations.details: Trade-off between quality and multi-person support

limitations.limitation: InfiniteTalk only works with Chinese model but knows English
limitations.details: wav2vec not needed for English as Chinese model handles it

limitations.limitation: SCAIL only supports single person with ViTPose
limitations.details: WanAnimate code limitation, doesn't show multi person hands/face

limitations.limitation: Path animator node only outputs 121 frames
limitations.details: Matches Wan ATI training, frame_count only changes path sampling, not output length

limitations.limitation: WanMove and SCAIL incompatible on base level
limitations.details: Cannot use both techniques together

limitations.limitation: TurboDiffusion int8 quantized weights incompatible with LoRAs
limitations.details: Would need to run LoRA separately, making it potentially pointless

limitations.limitation: InfiniteTalk FPS cannot be changed
limitations.details: Trained with 25fps, cannot change to 16fps to match other wan clips

limitations.limitation: No specific 720p LightX2V LoRA
limitations.details: 480p works with 720p model, 720p version was same LoRA merged to 720p model

limitations.limitation: ComfyUI loops are fragile
limitations.details: Don't allow starting/stopping partial executions, can't change something mid-loop and continue

limitations.limitation: Phantom is very fragile model
limitations.details: Could LoRA it but wouldn't be very helpful

limitations.limitation: VACE inpainting seams with tight crops
limitations.details: Tighter crop to masked area creates more visible seams

limitations.limitation: SCAIL facial expression fidelity
limitations.details: SCAIL isn't as faithful at maintaining facial expressions compared to LTX 2

limitations.limitation: LTX 2 pose copying
limitations.details: LTX 2 has poor fidelity in copying poses from video despite trying various settings (steps, cfg, IC Lora strength, prompting, etc.)

limitations.limitation: First-frame-last-frame flickering
limitations.details: Using first-frame-last-frame for video extension often results in weird flickering and color changes
